Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	O, my children, since I have completed this book for you, which is the final work on the science of medicine, achieving its goal at the end, and through its explanations and declarations, it seems to me that I should complement [it] with a treatise about manual practice, which is called surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	Because manual practice is neglected in our region and in our time, to the point where it barely exists, and its knowledge and remnants are suppressed; what remains of it can only be found as a few small descriptions in the books of the Ancients, which most people have distorted, leading them into error and uncertainty while their understanding is obscured and their skill and art degenerate.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	It seems necessary to me that I should revive it through the method of explanation and clarification, as well as by describing its tools in detail; both those used for cauterization and other instruments required for such work - this is needed so that people may understand these implements' shapes and forms, as part of the preparatory process.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	The reason why we lack good medical practitioners in our time is that the art of medicine demands a broad knowledge base: its practitioner must first be well-versed in anatomy, which encompasses an understanding of bodily structures and their functions; how various parts are connected or separated from one another; as well as an awareness about bones, nerves, tendons - their numbers and arrangements - along with veins (both pulsating and static), and the locations where they emerge.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason, Hippocrates says that it has a great name but small impact in practice, especially in the art of medicine.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already mentioned this in the introduction of this book; for whoever is not aware of what we have said about anatomy will not be relieved from falling into error, which has caused the deaths of many people, just as I have witnessed with those who are educated in this science but disregard both their knowledge and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	I saw a foolish and inexperienced doctor make an incision on the neck of a woman to drain a swollen abscess; he cut some arteries in her neck, causing great bleeding until she died from his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	I saw another doctor who was about to make an incision on the stomach of a man suffering from stones in his bladder; the stone was big, but he made the incision and extracted it with a piece of the bladder, causing that man's death three days later.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	I was once called to extract one of those stones and I saw that due to the size of the stone and the condition of the patient, I knew he would die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then you untie him according to his wishes, and then you rest, and after some days you let us untie the bandages; and he will be like this until the thigh and foot ulcers are cured, and he recovers.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And I was called to him, and I prepared to untie the bandages, and as a result, he experienced tranquility and relief from his pains.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, the decay had already set in within the member, which I could not stop; and the decay kept spreading throughout the member until the patient was in danger.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	I saw another physician who lanced a cancerous abscess; it became an ulcer after some days and increased the suffering of the patient's lord.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which is due to the fact that a black cauterization is made of melancholic humor; so it's not surprising that it turns into something iron-like in its entirety but rather remains limited to the affected member.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And for this reason, my children, it is necessary for you to consider the operation in two ways: one which brings healing and health, and another that carries danger in its most important aspects.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take up your arms with solicitude and protection from God, and treat your patients with ease and steadfastness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	Use the best course of action with God's grace for their well-being and praiseworthy recovery; leave behind those terrible illnesses that are difficult to cure. Keep your arms away from what causes you fear, so that doubt does not diminish your faith or reputation: For it is more glorious to remain steadfast in your honor and integrity, both here on earth and in the eyes of your holiness.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	A scholar had once said in his teachings:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat dangerous illnesses, lest you be known as bad doctors.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And I have divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	The division of the book begins, and first in the first part:
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter is ordered according to the feet, their different instruments and tools for cauterization, as well as all that is required during surgery.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second chapter.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter, about dryness and puncturing, cupping, wounds, and the extraction of arrows or similar objects, with everything well-ordered regarding the forms of instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third chapter.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, about restoration and dislocation, and the treatment of twists or similar injuries; this chapter is ordered regarding the head to feet, and the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	Of cauterization with fire and sharp medical tools, as well as a reminder of the operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	With this, we begin the treatise for the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Cover that I describe the quality of the iron for this cautery and its accompanying instruments, and in which circumstances it is forbidden to use cauterization.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore I say that the sermon on the quality of the iron for cauterization and its instruments is long and prolix, subtle in its science, and secretively hidden; great multitudes of wise men have spoken of it, and they are disagreed amongst themselves, so a small part of their sermons suffices for me, lest I prolong this too much.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	Here is the translation of each line: 
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And one should say that whoever says the opposite of this, that cauterization is beneficial for all chronic and dry illnesses that affect the body's humors, because when you compare the human body to fire, you find the body humid.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And I say this based on the words of that person, because I have already experienced it myself several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not appropriate for someone who has already been tried and tested in the chapter on cauterization through previous practice, and understands the variety of human constitutions and the location of diseases within their bodies, as well as the causes of those diseases, and the progression over time.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other constitutions, you should not be afraid, especially in cases of cold and humid illnesses, as all doctors have agreed upon this and there is no disagreement among them about the benefits of using cauterization for such ailments.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	Know, my sons, that the secret of healing through cauterization with fire and its effectiveness lies in the use of caustic medicine. This is because fire is a simple element, and its action only affects the part being cauterized without significantly harming any adjacent body parts.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra." 
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	Here is my translation of your provided text: 
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Furthermore, the use of excessive cautery is justified by its speed in action, the strength of its therapeutic effect, and the greatness of its lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	It is possible that the illness may return at some point in time depending on the constitution of the patient, the location and nature of their ailment, and their overall health, as well as any underlying conditions or excesses present within them, and the types of food and lifestyle factors they engage in; however, if the illness being treated with cauterization is a subtle one affecting a member that has few excesses and humidities, such as toothache and similar pains, it is likely that the pain will not return after cauterization, especially when done on a small scale.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	The common saying is that cauterization is the last resort in medicine, and this is a true statement according to those who understand it; they believe it to be so because there are no other cures or remedies available besides medicine and cautery itself.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	The reason for this is contrary to what one might think; the intention behind calling cauterization the last resort of medicine is not absolute, but rather it refers to specific cases where other methods of treatment and medicines have been tried first without success, and only at the end of this process does one administer cautery as a means to achieve cure.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And here it is important to note that cauterization is the last resort of medicine, not according to the intention of those who are uneducated or foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	The ancient practitioners said that cauterization with gold is better than that done with iron, and they said this due to the purity of gold and its sublime nature.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	They also said that the place of cauterization does not weaken the arm, but this is not entirely true, as I have proven and found that it only has this effect on certain bodies and not others. Cauterization with gold is good and better than iron, just as they claimed; however, when you use gold for cautery, remember that it must be declared [to the authorities], as it can be stolen according to its quantity due to the value of gold, and because it prepares one to receive an illness. And if you put gold into a fire, it will melt due to the heat, and there may be some flakes in the fire which the artisan could collect for their own benefit.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And thus, for this reason, one must do the cauterization with iron in a lighter and more precise manner to ensure the accuracy of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	I have already arranged this chapter on cauterization according to the chapters [preceding it], and I have placed those concerning the feet within the scope of this chapter so that the reader can easily find what they seek.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.
Le capitol primier.	The first chapter.
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization procedure provides relief from excessive moisture and coldness in the brain, which are two underlying causes of many traumatic conditions often referred to as *corissa*. These conditions can include head bleeding, discharge from the ears and eyes, frequent sleep disturbances, toothaches, and throat pain. Moreover, this treatment is universally applicable for all ailments caused by coldness, including paralysis, strokes, and similar illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The procedure for this cauterization is as follows: First, instruct the patient to take a laxative medicine that will empty their bowels three or four nights in advance. The specific time frame should be determined based on the patient's health condition, age, and usual habits.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	Then, ask the patient to shave their head with a razor and have them sit on a chair or bench with their arms raised and resting on their own legs.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	And then, place the edge of your palm gently on top of their nose between their eyes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, once your middle finger has reached the desired spot, mark that area with a tent. Then, prepare the olive-shaped cautery, which should have this shape:" [Here, please describe or provide an image of the shape referenced.]
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then place that over the marked spot with caution, in such a way that it descends gradually, and your hand will be forced to move away from it little by little as you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	And then gently lift your hand and look at the spot; if you see any part of the bone or skull already exposed to view along with some amount of gray matter, raise your hand and, without returning it to that same iron instrument, use another one that has been cooled while being seen by others what I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take some salt and dissolve it on the spot, leaving it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	And then place on it some frozen cotton soaked in vinegar, leaving it until the burn scar is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the wound with tetrapharmakon ointment until it heals.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it has been said that when the Roman plague breaks out, the arm gets better so quickly because it is more beneficial and healing.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And some of them say that the ulcer should be cauterized to the bone and that the cautery should be held in place until a part of the surface layer of the bone is burnt.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	And then remove this which adheres to the bone, and it shall be cured.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	Other doctors say that the cautery should be applied to the back part of the bone and it must press strongly against the bone until the bone gives way. This is the form of a small lancet:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	They believe that from this place, vapours escape from the head.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	If the wound is left open for too long, it will be cured only after consolidation.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I have not seen these two types of cautery being used anywhere except in rare cases due to fear; however, I consider that, overall, it is better for health because the head becomes weakened by the solution of its continuity as we mentioned before regarding other body parts and especially when the patient's head has a hot nature.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	The first type of cautery is safer and better in my opinion, and I use this method to promote health.
Capitol segon.	It seems that you are referencing the second chapter or section of your treatise. Please provide more context if you'd like me to continue translating! I am ready whenever you are.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery for the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When severe and long-lasting head pain occurs in a patient and all methods of treatment are exhausted, such as wars, cocks, cataplasms, emplasters, poultices, baths, pigeons, chicken eggs, and similar remedies, especially if cauterization has already been performed with a cautery that did not benefit the patient nor alleviate any of those causes; then consider whether the patient's head is of strong constitution in its nature; it is not cold and presents great heat, then cauterize again with another cautery below the previous one.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	Then cauterize that spot above their ear with a divided (hot) iron.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Incise the vein and expose the bone in the amount we have described; then cauterize it with a divided iron behind the head in the spot called the fossa, which is where the cupping glass is applied.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And be careful with your hand in this procedure; do not expose the bone, as the patient will feel great pain different from that of other cauterizations on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And I will place this cautery in its proper position, for the cautery with which you cauterize the horns of the head and the occiput is a more subtle cautery than that used to cauterize the middle part of the head; and this is its shape.
Capitol ters.	Chapter three.
De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the cauterization of new hemorrhoids.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr.	When pain starts at the base of the skull or extends behind the eyes, treat it with medicines that clear the head and administer other cures I have mentioned for various illnesses; if all is ineffective, then proceed to cauterization in two ways: either cauterize with sharp burning medicine, or with iron.
Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	The first type of cautery using burning medicine is when you take a piece of garlic, peel it, and cut off the tips on both ends.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	Then make an incision in the pain site on the temple with a lancet inserted at a point where it is done below the hairline but hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	Then press down on it with a wad of cotton to stanch the flow and leave it there for three hours; then remove the garlic and apply the residue for two or three days, after which place on the site an oak gall soaked in vinegar until the wound closes.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat him with ointment until he is healed.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you wish, make some caustic medicines for him, which I have written about in the second chapter of my treatise on caustic remedies.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	The cauterization with iron should be performed in this manner: ignite the following type of cautery...
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called the claw-hammer, as its head has the shape of a nail with some curvature, and in its middle part there is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then place it over the painful area, hold your hand - so that the arch does not adhere below - and turn the iron slowly but swiftly.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the amount of it that sticks to the skin is as much as half a nut, raise your hand so that the artery below does not adhere and thus prevent any blood flow.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then soak cotton in salt water and place it on the area for three days. After that, apply moistened cotton with ointment until he is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you cauterize at the tip of the ulna nerve according to the [type] of cautery, and be careful not to cut the artery in this not-so old embolism.
Capitol quart.	Chapter four.
De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of old embolism.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os.	When you treat an old embolism with what we have said about the previous treatment and what has been mentioned in the divisions of diseases, and if the treatment is not effective due to a disease that does not respond adequately to the first cauterization using medicine or fire cauterization, then it becomes necessary for you to ignite a cuticular [?] cautery until it becomes white, because this signifies the location of pain along the length of half a finger width, or whatever that is; and place your hand on it once and firmly press down while inserting the bowstring and preventing any movement.
Empero necessari es a tu que guardes de la continuacio de la mandibula, la qual es mauguda deves la masticacio, e que le lacert no sia adhurit e le nervi le qual mau aquela, e que no s’endevengua espasme.	However, it is necessary for you to be mindful of the continuation of the jaw, which is weakened by chewing, and that the lizard [?] muscle must not be adhered and the nerve that moves it, lest a spasm occurs.
E si es sobre la custodia e cautela de flux de sanc de l’arteria que es abciza, quar en la abcizio de lu es temor, e majorment ad aquel le qual ignora aquo que fa e no es studios e esproat; e layssa la operacio en lu al comensament.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And I will come back to the recollection of the regimen for accidental blood flux from archery according to its way, in its place within this book.
E si veses de aquesta malautia que no abaste aquest cauteri e veses le cors del malaute tollerable, cauteriza aquel en le mieg loc del cap ayssi cum havem recontat, e cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And if you see that this disease is not yet ready for the cautery and observe that the patient's body can tolerate it, cauterize them on the top of their head as we have described earlier, and treat the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, aministra le cauteri le qual havem dit en le capitol de streccio de arceria am cauteri havent dos cotels, e es milhor cauterizacio aquesta e mays conferent.	And if you want to apply the cautery we mentioned in the chapter on archery wounds with two irons (scissors), this is the better and more suitable method of cauterization.
Capitol .v.	Chapter 5: On Treating Wounds from Gunshots and Archery with Cautery and Medicines
De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the cauterization of ear pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When there is pain in the ear due to moisture and it is treated with laxative substances and other remedies as mentioned in the previous chapter, but the pain persists, then apply the cautery known as 'puncta', which has this form:
E aprop puncta aprop la ignicio, e sia menat al enviro de tota la aurelha ayssi cum roda es revolguda, o en le circuit de quascuna essemps si la dolor es en quascuna.	Then make the 'puncta' on the affected area, and move the ignited iron around the entire ear as if you were drawing a circle, or focus on each individual part if the pain is localized.
Alonga te am le cauteri de la razit de la aurelha pauc a pauc pus que aias senhat le loc am tenta.	Along with you hold the cautery of the root of the ear little by little more than having marked the place with smoke.
E si le cauteri de detz puntz en tota aurelha, e quays aquela, e aprop cura les locz entro que sian sanatz.	And if all the points in the ear are cauterized, as well as those that have been pricked, then treat the places until they are healed.
Capitol .vi.	It seems you are referring to chapter 6 of this medieval medical treatise. Can I assist with translating any further text?
De cauterizacio de turtura.	On the cauterization of torture.
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	Turtura la cual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las cuales vienen per flecma, segun que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias.	When you treat that type of torture with diuretics and purgatives and rinsings, and your treatment does not work, it is then necessary to cauterize the patient with three cauteries: The first should be at the root of their ear, the second just below their temple, and the third at the junction of two lips.
E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	Place your cautery on the opposite side of the affected area, for relief will only come from the seemingly healthy part.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The way to perform the cauterization is as follows: With one cautery, burn the topmost point of the ear, just above the horn; with another, target an area on their temple, the length of which should be no longer than a finger's width. Hold your hand over the cautery until half a codenait of skin has been consumed by the flame.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	The shape of this cautery is like that of the butcher's knife; its blade is flat.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	Yet it is more delicate than that, requiring only a small amount of flesh to be cut away in order for its superfluous thickness to diminish somewhat.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the wound with something that is freshly processed until it has healed.
Capitol .vii.	Capitol .vii.: Chapter 7. 
De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua.	De cauterizacio de apoplextia antiqua: On cauterization for old stroke (or seizure).
Quan apoplextia es antiquada e curas aquela am aquo que havem dit e no confereys la tua medicacio e le malaute no ha febre, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris: sobre totz les corn del sieu cap; e am cauteri e le mieg loc del cap, ayssi cum havem dit; e am cauteri en le coguot.	When apoplexy is old and you have treated it with what we have mentioned before but the patient has no fever, then cauterize them with four cauteries: on all corners of their head; with a cautery in the middle of the head, as we said before; and another one at the nape.
E la manieyra del cauteri es fayta segon que es desus dit.	The way of using the cautery is done as previously described.
E ja es cauterizat sobre la boca del estomac; e es mays derier; e aprop sia curat am aquo que procezeys.	He has already been cauterized on the stomach area; this is done later; then treat him with what proceeds.
Capitol .viii.	Chapter 8.
De cauterizacio de obblivio fayta per flacma.	About the cauterization of forgetfulness done with flame.
Cove que sian donatz al malaute en le comensament jerras grans e pilulas le servel mondificantz.	Give the patient at the beginning big bowls and pills of fresh cheese.
E aprop ras le cap tot del malaute e pausa sus le coguot de lu emplaustre de cetre descrit en le tractat dels emplastres.	Then shave the entire head of the patient and place on his nape a plaster as described in the treatise of plasters.
E pausa aquel alcunas veguadas, quar aquel es manieyra de cauteri.	And leave it for some time; that is how the cauterization is done.
E fay aquo segon aquel meteys orde le qual ja he dit.	Do this in the order previously mentioned by me.
E donc si per aqueles sanat bo es; e sino, lahoras fay a lu tres cauteris en la deriera partida de sieu cap, les quals sian deysendentz de la partida pus sobirana del cap entro a la partida pus dejos del col.	So if it heals him well by doing this; and if not, then do three cauterizations on the back of their head, which will go from above to below.
E pausa entre quascun cauteri la grossetut del dit, e aprop cura lo cauteri am aquo que es procedit.	Place between each cauterization the thickness of a finger, and then take care to do the cautery with what has been provided.
Mays si tu vos addicio e le malaute es aquo tollerant, lahoras fay a lu cauteri en le mieg loc; e si voys major addicio, lahora cauteriza aquel sobre les dos corns.	If you notice an increase in the disease and the patient tolerates it well, then do the cauterization on their forehead; but if there is a more severe increase, cauterize over both temples.
Aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat; e sia le cauteri olivar segon la forma denant donat.	Then take care of them until they heal; and let the cauterization be olive-shaped, as previously described.
Capitol .ix.	It seems that you are referring to chapter 9 in this treatise. Would you like me to translate any other text?
De cauterisacio de parazili e de mollificacio de tot le cors.	On the cauterization of parasites, and on softening all the body.
Cove que tu procesiscas en mondificacio del cap am jerras e am aquo que havem dit; e aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap, e am cauteri sobre totz les corns del cap, e am cauteri sobre la deriera partida de lu, e am tres cauteris sobre les spondils del col.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E si es necessari en la malautia de mollificacio del cors de trops aquel e les malautes tollerantz e la malautia es fort, lahoras cauteriza aquel am quatre cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e dererament am cauteri entro que sia comborit de la codena mot de lu, e aleva la tieua ma.	Under severe conditions of heart softening and associated diseases in which the patient is very ill, use four pointed cauteries on their vertebrae, then follow up with cautery through an incision made by a sharp object near the navel, and lift his other hand.
E aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat, e aquest sia cauteri olivar.	Then treat them after they have healed with olive oil cautery.
Capitol .x.	Chapter 10.
De cauterisacio de epilemcia.	On the cauterisation of epilepsy.
No es cauterizat le epilemtic sino aquella epilemcia es per flecma.	Do not cauterise an epileptic unless their epilepsy is caused by phlegm.
E donc cove que mondifiques le cervel de lu al comensament de lu am yeras e am l’autra curacio la qual havem dicta en la divisio quan le malaute es gran e es tollerant la exceperacio de las medicinas.	You must change the patient's brain from the beginning with years of herbs and other treatment, as we said in the section when the patient is severe and intolerant to medicines.
E si es enfant le qual no sufferte las medicinas, lahoras aministra guarguarissmes e mastiguatoris le servel mondifican, denant aquo per motz dias, am bonifficacio de las viandas.	If the child does not tolerate medicines, then give them gargles and chews that change their brains, for several days beforehand, with beneficial food.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en le mieg loc del cap segon la manieyra precedent, e am autre cauteri en le occiput de lu, e sobre quascun corn del cap sieu cauterisa.	Then shave the patient's head and cauterise them with one cautery on the top of their head as previously described; another on their occipital bone, and others on each corner of their head.
E si le malaute es fort e es tollerant, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteris les quals he ditz, en havent paraliticament e mollificacio del cors sobre les spondils del col e les spondils del dos.	Here is the translation of the first sentence: 
E sia cauteri olivar segon qu’es precedit.	And it should be treated with olive oil cautery as previously described.
Mays si le malaute es enfant, lahoras pausa cauteri subtil segon aquesta manieyra.	If the patient is a child, then use gentle cautery in this manner.
Capitol .xi.	I can provide a translation for you if you provide me with the text from this chapter or its contents.
De cauterizacio de melencolia.	Concerning the cauterization of melancholy." 
Quan las causas de melencolia so humiditatz corrompudas e flacma gros, lahoras cauteriza aquel am les cauteris les quals havem ditz en le havent paralisi.	When the causes of melancholy are corrupted moisture and weakness in the body, then cauterize it with the cautery we mentioned earlier for paralysis.
E si la causa de melencolia es superfluitat declinant a melencolia, e le cors del malaute es humit, lahoras da ha beure aquo que mundifica le cervel de lu segon aquo que ha precedut en la divisio.	And if the cause of melancholy is an excess that leads to this condition, and the patient's body is humid, then give them a drink to cleanse their brain according to the instructions given in the previous section.
E aprop ras le cap del malaute, e aprop fay tortora decentment fayta de li sobre le cercle, e aprop depausa aquela en le mieg loc del cap.	Then shave the patient's head, and make a decently-sized pigeon tail above their circle of hair, then place it in the middle of their scalp.
E le malaute sia sesent cayrat, e sia tengut de tota partida.	If the patient is sixty years old and is suffering from all four types [of melancholy].
E aprop pausa liniment; et es pus digne de boder antic de ovelhas.	Then apply the ointment, and it is more worthy to use old sheep fat for this purpose.
E escalfa aquel sobre le foc per calefaccio temprada per mesura, le qual le dit sufferta quan es mes en lu.	And heat it up over the fire to warm it up moderately, which is said to be tolerated by the patient when applied.
E aprop vuo’ aquel en le mieg loc del cap de lu en le cercle, e leysa lu entro que sia enfregidat.	Then place it in the middle of their head on the circle, leaving it there until it cools down.
E fay aquo am le malaute en tota semmana una veguada, am le autre regiment de lu bo entro que sia sanat; o si vols, cauteriza aquel fazen petitz puntz segon lo mays de lu, sino que tenguas la ma am un cauteri ayssi ordenat: aquesta es specia de cauteri la qual humecta le cervel am equalitat.	Do this to the patient once a week until they are healed; or you can perform another treatment on them if you wish, using small punctures according to their needs, but make sure your hand holds an ordered cautery like this one: this is a type of cautery that moistens the brain equally.
E aprop pausa aquel coto enbegut en boder o en grays de gualina.	And then place that swollen elbow in butter or goose grease.
Capitol .xii.	The number XII in Roman numerals is 12, so this may refer to chapter twelve of the treatise. However, I cannot provide an accurate translation or interpretation without the corresponding text. Can you provide me with the relevant information for Chapter 12?
De cauterisacio de aygua descendent en le huel.	Regarding the cauterization of descending aqueous humor in the eye." 
Quan a tu es declarat le comensament de aygua en le huel per les senhals les quals yeu he ditz en la divisio, lahoras comensa e dona en beure al malaute aquo que mondifique le cap de lu, e guarda aquel de totas humiditatz.	When you have identified the onset of water in the heel through the signs I mentioned earlier (in an earlier section), then start and give the patient to drink that which changes his head (presumably a liquid medication), and protect him from all humidity.
E fay aquel suzar en banh en degu per alcus jorns.	And let him sit in a warm bath for a few days.
E aprop comanda a lu que raza le sieu cap, e cauteriza aquel am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap; e aprop cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre dos templas si es le comensament de ysement de aygua en dos huels, o de la un latz si es comensamen de l’aygua en un huel.	Then instruct him to shave his head and cauterize that spot with a single cautery on the top of his head; or if there is an onset of water in both heels then use two cauteries on two temples, or one if it's just on one heel.
Incideys am cauteri totas las venas e arcerias las quals so dejos la codena; e sian les cauteris en aquela lonh en la latitut de las templas.	Lacerate with a cautery all the veins and arteries which are underneath the chain (of wounds); and let these cauterizations be made at that distance from the top of his head, towards where his temples would be. 
E guarda te de fluxs de sanc quan es cauterizat; e si veses de lu fluxs de sanc, osta le am alcuna medicina, la qual es a tu possible.	And be careful of blood flows when you are cauterizing him; and if you see any blood flowing from the wounds, stop it with whatever medicine is available to you.
E yeu vindre am savieza la qual es en extraccio de arcerias e am abscizio de aquelas e cautela de fluxs de sanc.	I will come with the knowledge of extracting arteries, as well as removing them and stopping blood flows.  I hope this text was of assistance!  Please let me know if you would like me to continue translating any more of these lines for you.
E alcunas vetz es cauterizat en le cervitz dejos dos osses am dos cauteris dererament produzitz.	And sometimes it is cauterized at the neck below the jawbone with two newly made cauteries.

De cauterizacio de lacrimas antiquas.	Concerning the cauterization of old tears." 
Quan lacrimas dels huels so antiquas assuduament e per las venas e arterias las quals so en le loc manifest del cap defora e es verificat que aquo es superfluitatz frejas flecmatiquas, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri le qual havem recontat en le capitol de comensament de aygua cazent en les huels, e am cauteri en le mieg loc del cap e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos templas, e am dos cauteris en la cervitz dejos dos osses.	When tears from the eyes are old and frequent, flowing through veins and arteries located in an apparent place on the head, it is verified that this is due to superfluous phlegmatic humors. Then cauterize this with a cautery, as we mentioned at the beginning of the chapter regarding hot water for the eyes, with one cautery in the middle of the head and two each below both temples and below both bones.
E si indigeyses de addicio, lahoras cauteriza aquel en tot latz de la coa del huel sobre la extremitat del sobrecilh am petit cauteri.	And if there is a need for addition, then cauterize it in all places on the tail of the eye above the end of the eyebrow with a small cautery.
Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter 14.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On the cauterization of bad smell from the nose.
Quan tu medicas aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no aprofieyta la tua medicacio, lahoras tu aparelha e dona en beure al malaute las cochias per tres noytz; e aprop ras le cap de lu, e cauteriza le am cauteri migier am cauteri olivar.	When you treat it with what we have mentioned in the division and your treatment does not benefit the patient, then prepare and give them to drink the pills for three nights; then shave their head and cauterize them with a small olea-shaped cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	Then cauterize it with two *clavus*-shaped cauteries, each slightly below the hairs of both eyebrows.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful with the arrow so as not to break it.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	As for the pointed cautery, this is its shape.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter 15.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	Regarding the softening cautery for the eyelids of owls.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the owl's eyelid is softened due to illness or humidity, treat it with this lunar-shaped cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you wish to treat it above the two eyebrows with a small one in multiple pieces, and they extend from the temples.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And its length should be proportionate to the quantity of eyebrow.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press your hand too hard on the cautery, but rather according to how much of the eyelid's skin is attached.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter 16.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Regarding the eyelid of an owl when its feathers have turned into multiple parts within the fist of the owl.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the scabs on the sore are separated from those underneath so that it can be touched, they are cauterized in two ways: either with fire or with caustic medicine.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you use a cautery of fire to treat it, instruct the patient to clean their scabs just as those who wash them do, making sure they are prolonged and moist; if you have to apply this treatment to their nose, then you should bind his wounds with a bandage so that he is not bothered while the scabs form.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Once they are formed and moistened, place the patient's head on your knee, then mark their eyelids with a sign, which is shaped like the leaf of a myrtle tree, starting the mark near the scabs.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then apply hot cotton soaked in owl's albumen or mothball extract on the wound.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	Then ignite the following type of cautery.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	Then cauterize over the figure you have marked, little by little, with small visible dots, making sure that the surface of the area resembling a myrtle leaf is completely burnt.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	And a sign of healing from the wound is that you see the patient's eyelid contract and his hair stand up after the puncture.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	Therefore, lift your hand and leave him like that for three days, then place a splint on his arm until the fracture is healed.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then treat her with ointment until she is cured.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If the hair grows back for any reason and the eyelid becomes soft, then perform cauterization on it again as you did initially.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the hair is still on the eyelid, then cauterize it until it rises to its natural place and is level with the skin, ensuring that the hair does not hurt the eye.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	If the cauterization with an absorbent medicine is what you want the patient to pluck out his hair until they are lengthened and leveled, then make a cloth bandage in the shape of a myrtle leaf.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	Then take one ounce of known and living white gall, or what you call it, then mix these two ingredients well, and do this with haste so that it does not cool; then spread this over the cloth bandage which is shaped like a myrtle leaf, and place it on one or both eyes; then place the patient's head on a pillow stuffed with goose down, and let his head be in your lap.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And place your finger on the medicine and press it gently, being careful not to harm the patient before they feel the warmth of the medication, for this sensation is like fire burning within them.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	So when you perceive that the patient has felt this burning sensation, then remove the medicine and wipe it away with your finger; once the burning sensation subsides, take out the medication and wash the area with water. Then, examine whether the eyelid is raised as if washed, and you must apply a compress of hot towels or make an incision - whichever you deem necessary for the treatment to be successful. If not, repeat the application of medicine on the same spot where you have not pressed it before, being mindful that your operation should not be discredited.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	Then apply a bandage over the wound to ensure that any infection is eradicated from the adhesive surface; thereafter, treat it with an ointment or another medicine so that it may heal.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	It is essential that you pay close attention to your operation and ensure that none of the medication falls into the eye; if after a few days the eyelid becomes softened and any hairs cause discomfort in the eye, then repeat the medicine on this area of the eyelid as you did initially, and then have them rest so it may heal.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And know that men's bodies are diversified according to their size and smallness, and thus your treatment should be tailored accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And do not hide the way of learning from him who studies this art.

De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	Regarding the cauterization of a fistula in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula with the methods we have discussed in previous chapters and it does not respond to your treatment, then you must cauterize it using this method: instruct the patient to rest their head on your lap, and let one of your assistants hold their head gently between their hands so as to not cause discomfort or agitation.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	Then place the cauterizing tool, either made of silver or hair, on their eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And now ignite the cautery which has this shape:" (Here it is likely that there would be an accompanying illustration or description of the tool's shape.)
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	Which is concave, like the shape of a cane or an eagle's feather, with the cauterizing tip at one end.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you go, penetrate into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to get out, do so as quickly as possible.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, that which is concave is better for this operation.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	Then press on the open fistula and try to extract any unhealthy or moist matter from it.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then make an incision to remove the hardened matter.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place over it the well-lit cautery, and hold your hand near but not touching the cautery from below the nose, so as to avoid burning yourself or troubling the patient, then apply the cautery to the gray part of the wound and destroy that area.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And so if at the beginning of your cauterization process you perceive a hissing sound, it is good; and if not, then repeat the cauterization once or twice if necessary; leave it like that for three days, and then place cotton around it and cover with drying ointment until healed.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	But if eleven days have passed and it is not healed, then apply a strong corrosive medicine to uncover the bone and scrape according to what is appropriate in this chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora. De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	Concerning the cauterization of a mouth ulcer.
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat. E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol. Capitol .xx.	Chapter 20: Concerning fractures of bones and how to treat them.
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and the softening of veins.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the veins are softened due to moisture and the teeth are decayed, and you treat them with medicines but it does not work, then place the patient's head in your lap, and prepare the cautery tool with its shape as will be described below, so that you can insert the rod into the tooth. Be sure to hold it slightly above until the patient feels the heat of the fire reach the root of the tooth.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then lift your hand, and repeat the process with the cautery tool several times as you see fit.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then the patient should rinse their mouth with salty water and keep it there for an hour, after which they should spit it out, as the decayed tooth is now sealed, the softened gum is tightened, and the corrupting moisture has been dried up.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21. 
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	De cauterisacio de dolor de dent." 
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is caused by coldness or when there is a chill or worm in it, and you cannot cure it with medicine, then cauterization can be done in two ways: either with cow's horn cautery or with fire.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cow's horn cautery involves taking a piece of cow's horn and boring it with an iron rod. Then, take the heated horn and wrap it around the tip of the probe. Next, immerse the heated horn in water to cool it down quickly. Finally, place this cooled horn directly onto the painful tooth promptly until it is thoroughly chilled.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	Repeat this process several times until the healing properties of fire reach the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	If you want, immerse wool or a cotton swab in the cow's horn cautery liquid and place it on the painful tooth. Then, apply a heated iron rod onto that until the iron reaches the inner cavity of the tooth.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, when performing fire cauterization, be mindful of any boils or ulcers in the patient's body and ensure that the intensity of the fire does not reach their mouth.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Shape the cautery tool accordingly, place it on the tooth and hold your hand over it until the tool is thoroughly cooled. Perform this process multiple times, as the pain may return either that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And now, the patient should fill their mouth with good saliva due to the impression of that cautery, and hold it there for an hour then spit it out; this is how the cauterization process works.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	Cauterize any extremity that you observe, as is feasible for you to do so.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	This is how the cannula should be shaped:

De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On the cauterization of external hemorrhoids.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When hemorrhoids are caused by excess phlegm and cold humors, and they do not respond well to treatment with medicine but you observe a slight improvement in their digestion, then use this type of cautery which has two open ends so that the smoke can escape from one end while the other end is placed on the hemorrhoid. Apply it once and if necessary, repeat the process until you reach the root of the hemorrhoid.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	If the hemorrhoid is small, adjust the size of the cautery accordingly and leave it for three days, placing a cotton wad soaked in saliva over it until it has healed from the fire's burn." De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of vocal cords and the treatment of narrow airways.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity affects the lungs, especially when it is caused by a cold complexion, it is necessary to evacuate the patient at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that part which is affected near the throat.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	Be careful not to bring the cautery too close to the throat or burn its membrane, only slightly.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	Cauterize that part with another cautery tool near the joint of the neck in the back of his spine.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	Let the cauterization be clamped following the previous method.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And then treat him with what has been prescribed before he is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter 24." 
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	De cauterizacion del malautia del pulmón y la tos. (On the cauterization for lung disease and cough.)
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung disease are caused by excess humidity, and the patient has no fever or sputum production, and it is an old illness, then cauterize with two cauteries on the furcula (collarbone) in the areas below the lions (clavicle) and bumps; and with another cautery in the middle of the foot between two mammilla. The cautery should be pointed as described before.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, your cauterization can be done by puncturing with the cautery called "puncta," the shape of which was described earlier in the section on treating ear pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	If you make punctures in those places, then treat the patient with what was mentioned earlier to be put inside for healing.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And once the cautery has three handles, you can make three cauterizations with it in this manner:

De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On the cauterization of titillic, which is the head of the humerus bone.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz. If the dislocation is in their upper limbs and this has been done thus far, then cauterize over the muscle with a hooked cautery or several pointed cauteries, for the joint will be confirmed, the humidity expelled, and the patient cured.
