Forma de un autra inscissori; aquest semblant a ray, e la extremitat de lu es cum serra, e es exhibit en motz locs en la razio dels osses:	Another incisor resembling a saw with its end like a blade is displayed in many places for the treatment of bones." This seems to describe yet another surgical instrument akin to a small saw or a specialized bone cutting tool. The reference to its being "displayed in many places" suggests it was a commonly used and well-known instrument during that era, likely employed by medical professionals for various orthopedic procedures. Its design with a serrated end like a blade further emphasizes its purpose as a cutting tool for bones.
Forma de ray lo qual conveneys a rasio de aquel que es perforat dels osses:	A saw suitable for bone perforation." This text describes a type of surgical saw or drill designed specifically for creating holes or perforations in bones during medical procedures, likely orthopedic surgeries. The reference to its being "suitable for bone perforation" indicates that it was carefully crafted and intended for this specific purpose, ensuring precision and accuracy when used by medical professionals.
E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat.	E la extremitat de lu es triangulada e de aguda extremitat." 
E es fayt de ferr de India , e semblantment cove que totas las causas que havem ditas de rasoris e de inscissoris e de serras.	And it is made of iron from India, and similarly, it covers all the causes we have mentioned regarding razors, knives, and saws.
De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Regarding the incision of extremities and the cutting of bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities may require treatment due to intrinsic or extrinsic causes. If you have administered medication for the corruption but the cure does not take effect, and the corruption spreads to an uninjured part of the body without any apparent cause, it is necessary to incise that part where the infection has reached, so that the patient can escape death or severe illness which is more detrimental than the loss of the limb.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	The sign that this has occurred is when the limb turns black before it is burned by fire, or if the blackness spreads from that part of the body to other parts and eventually affects the whole body; in such a case, proceed with the incision.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	Similarly, if the cause of the corruption is due to the sting or bite of venomous creatures such as the scorpion, viper, adder, or similar, then proceed with the incision.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or injury is located at the tip of the finger, then you should cut into the finger and not give any space for the corruption to spread into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras.	Similarly, if the problem extends to the hand, then you should make an incision at the base of the forearm and not allow any space for the corruption to reach the arm.
E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	If instead of that, then make an incision on the arm above the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if the corruption goes beyond that and it surrounds the elbow, then at this point there is death for the patient; to administer any other cause of cure besides this is a matter of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	Similarly, do the same for the foot when corruption goes beyond the toe; then make an incision above one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if it reaches the arch of the foot, then you should cut open the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	But if it goes further up to the shin, then make an incision on the leg above the ankle joint.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already reached the shin, then it is not treatment but release; leave the patient to their death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it is necessary that a cloth be placed over all parts so that it does not touch the affected area, and that the patient receives proper care and treatment for their injury or abscess.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	However, if there is bleeding during the procedure, you should cauterize the wound gently or apply some blood-clotting powders to it; then return to your medical treatment until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	Then bind the affected limb with suitable bindings, and keep caring for it until it is completely healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I recommend to you that this man should avoid walking on his foot due to the accident we mentioned earlier; it is an unfortunate incident where he injured the sole of his foot with burning, which was similar to fire-related burns.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that accidental injury first affected his toe before spreading to the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	Therefore, that man should prepare himself for the possibility of pus formation as he undergoes treatment on his foot, which will be painful and intense due to its severity; he must incise this foot up until the joint, and then it can heal.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	Long time afflicted with that same corruption in his right hand.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And so it came to me, and I must pierce that superfluity with what I put on his hand as medicine, thus cleaning his body; but the superfluity was not driven out, and I began going to the other side of his hand while beginning in his palm.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And he called me to incise his hand, but I did not want to do this hoping for the expulsion of that superfluity, and more so because I feared the incision into his dead hand, as the cause of his illness was over his heart.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And after he departed from me, he returned to his land and I heard that the man prepared and incised his entire hand, and was healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	I have not added this narrative other than for it to be helpful in understanding this illness, and that it may serve as an indication of what it means and how it should be treated.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the cure for abscesses and the quality of enemas with medicines.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs on any fleshy part of the body and the space of the abscess is elongated so as to form a collection of pus, and it breaks open and perforates, expelling its pus, leaving behind an empty cavity like a vessel, and with only thin linen cloth remaining over it, and no further corruption has occurred, nor does it affect bone or nerve or ligament, then this is called a sinus and not a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space is prolonged and corruption begins in any part of the body, it is then called a fistula, not an abscess.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	The treatment for it is to remove that affected area entirely as it stands, especially when it is ulcerated and formed like a piece of cloth, and ensure that it doesn't stick or attach itself back to the wound due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	But if you hope for the affected part to stick and for that corruption not to spread any further, and there is an absence of pus in the wound, then treat it with a clyster.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And if you consider the sinuses and find that they are large, and emit an offensive odor from the arm which has them, then treat it with a clyster using an Egyptian medicine made of oil, vinegar, and resin (frankincense) taken in equal parts, mixed together in a vessel, and heated over fire until the mixture thickens to the consistency of honey.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	Then take the required amount of this medicine and dissolve it in water and honey; use that to clyster the sinus, plug its opening, and let the medicine remain inside for two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then remove that with contempt; do this for as many days as it takes until the sinus is cleansed and the pus is absorbed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	Sometimes you may administer an enema with water and ash when this medicine is not available to you; take the ash from wood, mix it with water, and use that mixture to perform the enema until you notice that the sinus has been cleared.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	If the patient cannot tolerate Egyptian medication nor water with ash, then administer an enema with plain water and honey mixed together; you can also use wine mixed with honey as it has the property of cleansing and soothing, and the wine will adhere to the sinus, especially when there is superfluous astringency and dryness in the wine.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And when you have done this several times and notice that the sinus has been cleansed, then administer an enema with water that promotes flesh growth.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	Take some daffinicon ointment and dissolve it in rose oil and astringent wine, or you can use other medicines and ointments with properties that I have already written about in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.	E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat.
E semblantment si le orrifici es ample, lahoras tu agregua las labias de lu am sutura e layssa de lu quantitat en la qual intre le clisteri ses addicio.	And if the opening is wide, then you gather its lips with a suture and leave in it as much as the enema needs to enter.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening from which the arm protrudes is elevated to higher parts, then dry it in the lowest place within it so that the arm can enter smoothly because when the arm is constricted at the depth of a sinew, flesh will form there.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible for you to dry the sinew around the lowest area as desired, then you must prepare the member with preparation so that the arm can move lightly according to your desire and be restrained by nothing.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	Take consolidating medicines that are placed on the sinew, suitable for what you want to extend over linen cloth.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And let the cloth be of such great quantity that it covers the entire sinew; then cut it with scissors right at the opening of the sinew, making an incision wider than the opening itself; and then extend over another smaller linen cloth soaked in lion's fat, according to the size of the incision, placing it far from the opening of the sinew so as to keep the arm's discharge away from the large cloth and not expose that great cloth until a few days have passed.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	May he who is above the navel, who always pushes down for this reason that what is put in him of the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know if what runs from the arm is a lot or a little, whether it is digested or undigested.
E am aysso tu considera le loc de aquel sinu, si en lu sent le pacient dolor o no, e si es en lu apostema.	And you should consider the place of that navel, if the patient feels pain there or not, and if it is inflamed.
E cum la tua medicacio es prolonguada en la tal manieyra, e vesas la matiera que es gitada sobre le orrifici del sinu ja adhereys, o se apropria adherencia, lahoras le mayti tu le deslia o le tertz dia, e quan deslias la plagua, lahoras muda le drap per autre e renova le enguent.	And when your treatment is prolonged in this way, and you see that the matter which has been drawn over the navel has already adhered or has formed an appropriate adhesion, then on the third day you will release the patient's belt or girdle, and when you remove the plaster, then change it for another piece of cloth and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	But if from the navel a very thin fluid exudes then do not despair of the adhesion that has formed there, for its healing is appropriate, because only some people take time to form flesh in their wounds and those are the ones where the opposite occurs.
E si del sinu aprop motz dias es yssit brac indigest, lahoras sapias que·l sinu no adhereys; e si es tardada la adherencia del sinu e es la causa prolonguada, lahoras tu ajusta en exsiccacio de las medicinas, e si las medicinas so humidas en lor substancia e en la sua vertut, son seccas ayssi cum enguent dyafinicon, quan es en lu ajustada superfluitat de addicio de zegi.	And if a lot of undigested fluid has come out from the navel for many days then know that the navel will not adhere; and if it is taking time for an adhesion to form in the navel and this situation continues, then you should use drying medicines, and if the medicines are moist by nature but dry in their action like unguent of diachylon when there is a superfluity of sharp humors.
E le mays derier am le qual es curat, es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e sia dissout en oli rozat, e sia sobre lu vojat vi antic engual en la sua substancia, e aprop comfeys aquel am lu, e usa de aquel.	And the last thing to do for their treatment is to take some ointment of diaphoretic and dissolve it in rose oil, and spread it over them like you would with a linen bandage on their substance, then apply that to them, and use it.
E ja fa semblant en aquela accio, quan no y a brac, enguent dyafinicon, mel quan es coyt entro que sia engrossat, e usa de lu; o que prenguas mirra e aloen e enses, e trissa tot e polveriza sobre le mel quan es sus le foc, e aprop lineys aquo sobre drap e strenh aquel sobre le sinu; e lineys aquel am le mel le qual has cuoyt entro que es engrossat, e polveriza sobre drap e strenh aquel.	And it seems like an odd action when there are no arms to apply the diaphoretic ointment, you can use fat instead as a substitute or melt together myrrh and aloe with wax, grind everything into powder over fire, then spread this mixture onto cloth and place that on their side; also spread this with melted fat which has been thickened, sprinkle it with powder on a piece of cloth and place that.
E alcunas veguadas so administratz am lu aristologia longua e razitz de lili celesti (e es lili celesti) e farina de errs e centaurea, e usa de aquels simples o ajustatz, trissa aquels e cribela e polveriza sobre le mel le qual he recomtat; e husa de lu.	And sometimes it is administered to them with aristology, long pepper roots and celestial lily (which is celestial lily) as well as the flour of ergot and centaurea, you can use these simple ingredients or combine them altogether, grind those together then sift and powder over honey that has been melted; and use this mixture.
E si es prolonguat le sinu, e no es sanat per aquesta curacio, lahoras sapias que la corrupcio es en le preon de lu, e ja fa enquisicio en les osses o en les autres membres durs o als liaments; lahoras tu le cura am curacio fistular, ayssi cum desus es dit.	And if the side is still sore and has not been healed by this treatment method, then know that the corruption is in its depth, already inquiring into their bones or other hard members or ligaments; then treat them with fistula treatment, as mentioned above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panarici is an abscess that forms beneath the nail of the big toe or little finger; it may also appear on other fingers/toes but this is rare. When prolonged and treatment is delayed, or if it becomes infected, pus spreads and corrodes the root of the nail, potentially corrupting the entire region and spreading infection to the bone (signaled by an odor). The tip of the affected digit will become discolored and darken.
E donc quan tu auras aquel am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu inscidas am ferr tota la superfluitat que es romasa de la ungla e aprop cauteriza la plagla aprop aquo, quar cauteri mot es juvatiu en aysso.	And so, when you have the aforementioned condition as described in the previous section but your treatment does not bring relief, it is necessary to extract all superfluous matter remaining beneath the nail and then cauterize the wound afterwards, for cauterization is greatly beneficial in this case.
Mays si le os es sa e la ungla es sana, e las addicios de la ungla vuoydas ja compremen las carns a las partidas dedintz, e comensan lu punger e ledeysso aquela, lahoras cove que tu pauses ray subtil dejos le angle de la ungla que pungeys la carn, e impelleys aquela sus e inscideys aquela carn am facilitat, e pausa sobre aquo que roman de la carn de las medicinas comburentz corrosivas entro que sia tot remaugut; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	If the bone is healthy but the nail is detached and its roots compress the flesh around it, causing pain to said flesh when touched and drawing blood, then one must place a thin blade beneath the edge of the nail that pierces the skin and extract that skin with ease; put whatever remains of this flesh onto corrosive medicine so that all may be dissolved. Then treat the wound with ointment until healed.
Mays si la corrupcio ja enprem en le os, lahoras cove que tu inscidas le os aquel e le extraguas, car nul temps no es sanat que sia en lu le os corrumput.	But if corruption has already penetrated the bone, then you must cut into the bone and remove it, for there is no hope of healing when a corrupted bone remains.
E si vezes la corrozio e la corupcio anar en le dit, lahoras tu inscideys aquel en un dels nozes segons que es premesa la sua rememoracio, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if you see the corruption and its progression in the finger, then you must cut into one of the joints depending on which is affected by its memory, and then cure it before it heals.
Mays si a la ungla endeve percussio o atricio, e endeve en aquela dolor vehement, lahoras cove que tu al comensament fleubotomes le malaute, e aprop secca la ungla am spatum agut am seccio transversa desus en jus, e guarda te que la seccio no pervengua entro a la carn que es dejos la ungla, quar tu faras accidir al malaute dolor vehement, e sira causa a nativitat de la carn ajustada superflua en le loc; e aprop cura aquel loc am aquo que ceda dolor.	But if the nail suffers trauma or injury and becomes extremely painful, then you must first bleed the patient, and then use a sharp instrument with a transverse edge to cut off the nail from above downwards, ensuring that the incision does not reach into the flesh underneath the nail, as this will cause intense pain and could lead to an overgrowth of scar tissue in the area; treat the affected area with remedies for pain relief.
Mays dit ajustat, le qual es nat en las mas de alcus homes, fort leu es carnos tot, e fort leu so en lu osses, o fort leu es en lu ungla.	This finger deformity, which is born in the hands of some men, contains very little flesh and rarely has bones or nails.
E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	Some of these deformities appear at the base of the joints or are formed in some of the finger joints.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	May he who is born with defects in his fingers not be harmed, but one born with severe joint problems may face difficulties.
E de aquels que son natz carnoses, la seccio es leugiera, e es que tu inscidas aquel deves la sua razitz am spatum lat.	And for those born with fleshy bodies, the incision should be light, and you must insert the spatula laterally.
Mays de aquel que es nat en la razitz de la junctura, la curacio es dificil; e donc guarda te de la abscizio de lu.	However, for someone born with a defect at the root of the joint, healing is difficult; therefore, beware of his excision.
Mays en aquel que es nat en dit deves les nozes, cove que tu inscidas al comensament la carn de lu am inscizio redonda entro al os, e aprop serra am una de aquelas serras convenientz ad aquo, e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	But for one born with a defect in the fingers above the knuckles, it is necessary that you make an initial round incision into their flesh and then saw with one of those saws suitable for this, and then treat him until he is cured.
Mays consolidacio la qual accideys als ditz entre lor motas veguadas o per nativitat del home que nays enayssi, o per consolidacio de plagua o per combustio de foc, o per semblantz, adonc cove que secces aquela consolidacio entro que les ditz retorno a la sua forma natural.	However, for the consolidation that occurs in fingers due to visible swelling or from congenital defects, or from the healing of injuries or burns, it is necessary to cut off this consolidation until those fingers return to their natural form.
E aprop pausa entre lor draps de li enfuzes en oli rozat per que no sian consolidatz leugierament, e separa entre aquels, o pausa entre aquels una lamina de plom subtil entro que sia consolidat segon que cove.	Then place the patient between clean sheets and fill them with rose oil so that they are not lightly consolidated, or separate those fingers with a thin lead plate until they consolidate as required.
E semblantment si accideys consolidacio en alcus ditz am la palma, lahoras tu secca aquela consolidacio segon que es preparada e conveneys a la figura del membre.	And likewise, if hardening occurs in some parts of the palm, you remove that hardened part according to its preparation and suitability for the shape of the member.
De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Regarding incisions, there are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz.	Varicose veins are dilated and thick veins filled with superfluous melancholic humors that appear in parts of the body, especially on the legs, primarily on the legs of travelers, workers, and carriers.
Adonc cove que tu administres purguacio del cors de colera negra alcunas veguadas am expulcio fort, e aprop sangna le pacient de la vena basilica.	Therefore, you should administer a purge of black bile from the body several times with force and then bleed the patient from the basilic vein.
Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The treatment of varicose veins with iron can be done in two ways: either by incision and drawing out the black blood or by elevating the vein and extracting it entirely.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision is done in this manner: first, bathe the leg with cold water until the thick blood from the leg is resolved and becomes more liquid; then bind the patient's leg tightly above the hip and below it with a bandage; next, cut into the vein at one point or two or three places with wide incisions; after that, draw out the black blood by gently pulling down on the part of the vein closest to their foot towards the part just under the knee; do this until you have drawn off enough blood and removed its harmful qualities.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	And then bind him/her up, and command them to abstain from foods that generate black bile.
E itera la curacio per fleubotomia quan las venas so umplidas e aquo notz al malaute.	Repeat the cure by means of bloodletting when the veins are full, and he/she feels better.
Mays la elevacio de lor es segon aquesta manieyra: tu que razas la camba del malaute, si en lu so motz pels, e aprop met le en banh e embroca la camba de lu am aygua cauda entro que s’enrogesesca e las venas sian exuberadas; o que sia exercitat per exercici fort, si banh no es a tu present, entro que·l membre sia scalfat.	However, their elevation is done in this manner: you who scratch the patient's leg, if he/she has dead flesh, then immerse him/her in a bath and douse the leg with cold water until it reddens and the veins are raised; or if there be no bath available, have him/her exercised vigorously so that the limb is scraped.
E aprop secsa la codena en le dreyt de la vena per seccio en le lonc o en le derier de lu deves le denol, o en le pus bas de lu deves lo talo.	Then cut the cord on the right side of the vein by incision into his/her thigh or in his/her behind you should pull it out, or at its lowest point you should cut it off.
E aprop uobre la codena am uncis e excorja la vena de tota part entro que appara al sentiment, e es deves la appericio de lu que vezes aquela roga declinant a negror.	Then open the cord with hooks and strip the vein from all parts until it appears in view, and you should look for what you see as thread turning towards blackness.
E donc cum evazeys e de la codena tu vezes aquela blanca quays sia corda.	And thus, when you draw out (blood) and see the cord white in appearance, it is good.
E aprop tu met dejos aquela le ray entro que sia elevada e sia gitada de la codena, e sospen aquela am onci orp leon.	And then you place under them a board that is raised and tilted towards the head end, and suspend their arm on a pulley system.
E aprop secsa autra seccio aprop aquela seccio per tres ditz, e aprop excorja la codena de la partida desus de la vena entro que apparia.	Then suture another section just beyond that one with three stitches, and carefully cut the skin of the head end back to expose the vein.
E aprop eleva aquela e inscideys aquela en deriera seccio deves le talo, e aprop extratz aquela e eleva aquela entro que sia yssida per la seccio segonda, e aprop extratz aquela de la seccio que es sobre aquela.	Then lift it up and make an incision in the rear section behind the ankle, then extract it and push it out through the second section, and finally remove it from the section above.
E fay aquo entro que extraguas aquela de la seccio que es pus sobirana o pus auta de totas las seccios, entro que tota es yssida; e lahoras inscideys aquela.	Do this until you have extracted it from the most superior or highest section, once everything has been pushed out; then make an incision.
E si no obezeys a tu ad extrayre e elevar, lahoras intromet una agulha am fiel fort doble e ligua aquela e extratz la, o intromet dejos lu le ray e revolveys la tua ma a tota part entro qu’en sia getada.	If you are unable to extract and raise it, then insert a strong double-pointed needle and use it to hook the vessel and pull it out, or insert a board under them and rotate your hand around until it is freed.
E guarda te que no sia inscidida; quar si es trencada, es fayt a tu dificil elevar aquela mot e es vengut sobre le malaute per aquela nocument.	And be careful not to make an incision in it, for if you break the vessel, it will be difficult for you to remove the clot and the patient may suffer harm from its rupture.
E cum aquela tota auras fora-gitada, lahoras pausa sobre le loc de la plagua lana submerssa en vi e oli rozat e oli no-rozat, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And when the air around has been expelled, place on the wound a poultice of wool soaked in rose oil and uncolored oil, and treat it until it is cured.
E si la vit es contrayta havent tortuositat a la qual sia envolucio a las partidas, e no es segon rectitut segon que havem dit, lahoras cove que tu fendas sobre aquela a tota partida de tortuositat de lu e als locs de envolucio de lu, e aprop suspen aquela am uncis entro que eleves aquela tota.	And if the bowel is contracted with twists that bind its parts together, and it does not return to straightness as we have said before, then you should cut into it over all those twisted parts and binding points, and then suspend it with hooks until you lift it up.
E guarda te deves la tua seccio que no inscidas la vena e que no plagues aquela, quar dificil sira a tu elevar aquela; e serva la tua prudencia en aquela.	And take care not to cut into the vein and block it off, for it will be difficult for you to lift up that part; let your wisdom guide you in this.
Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The shape of the instrument with which you cut into the dried-out bowel:
Forma de unci orp:	Shape of lifting hooks:
No es a lu accuitat ayssi cum als uncis ni es de aguda extremitat per so que no plague la vena; e es de grossa flexibilitat leon, quar si era subtil, inscidira la vena per la sua subtilitat; habantz es en lu superflua grosseza ayssi cum havem dit.	It is not pointed like hooks nor has a sharp end so as to not pierce the vein; and it should be made of thick flexible iron, for if it were too thin, it would cut through the vein due to its thinness; there is a superfluous thickness in it just as we have said.
De extraccio venae cruris.	De extraccio venae cruris translates to "The extraction of the leg vein.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This translates to: "This vein is generated in the legs, in low-lying lands such as Al-Ateeqi in Arabia and the marshy lands of India that are dry, poor in vegetation, and have little grass.
E fort leu es engendrada en autres locs del cors otra las cambas.	And it is rarely generated in other parts of the body besides the legs.
E la gestacio de lu es de putrefaccio que ve dejos la codena ayssi cum venen dedintz le cors serpentz e vermps e scarides e verms engendrantz entre la codena e la carn.	Its formation comes from the putrefaction that follows an injury, just like how snakes, worms, scorpions, and other vermin breed inside a wound in the body.
E senhal de la suscepcio de l’adveniment de lu es de aquesta vena que accideys en la camba enflammacio vehement; e aprop le loc es vesicat; e aprop comensa la vena yssir del loc de aquela vesicacio quays sembla razit de planta.	A sign of its onset is the leg vein that appears in the thigh, causing severe inflammation; then blisters form there, and soon after, the vein begins to emerge from where these blisters appeared, looking like a plant's roots.
E adonc cum appar de lu la extremitat, lahoras cove que tu envolvas sobre aquela una pessa de plom del qual sia le pes de una drac. entro a ii drac., e noza aquela e layssa le plom suspendut de la camba.	Once it becomes apparent to you, take a piece of lead weighing one drachma or two drachmas and secure it around the vein; then leave this lead suspended from the thigh.
E tantas veguadas cum yeys de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, envolveys aquo em plom e noza aquel.	Every time it causes pain in other parts of the body besides the thighs, bind that area with lead as well and secure it.
E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquela de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.	E si mot es prolonguat, lahoras tu inscideys una partida de lu e envolopa le romanent; e no inscidas aquella de razit entro que sia fora yssida, quar si inscideys aquela es contrayta e intra en la carn e fa accidir apostema e poyredura en le loc e ulceracio mala.
Per que cove que sia tractada suaument e sia extrayta petit a petit, entro que sia fora-gitada del derier de lu e no remangua de lu alcuna causa en le cors.	For this reason, it is necessary that it be treated thoroughly and extracted little by little, until it is expelled from the patient's back, and no cause remains in their body.
E de aquesta vena es yssit en alcus homes que es en la sua longitut de v palms e de detz e ja es pervengut a mi que yssic un de xx palms.	And from this vein, I have heard that in some men it can be up to 10 palms [in length], and I even came across one individual whose vein reached an incredible 20 palms.
E si es inscidida en la hora de la sua medicacio, lahoras intromet lo ray en le trauc de lu e perfora aquela am lonc trauc am le cors, entro que sia evacuat tot aquo que es en la materia, e administra putrefaccio del loc per alcus dias am medicinas; e aprop cura aquela per la curacio de apostemas.	If it is cut during its treatment hours, then insert a rod into the wound and pierce that long gash across their body until everything within the affected matter is evacuated, and apply putrefaction to the area for several days with medicine; thereafter cure the wound through proper post-operative care.
E aquesta vena alcunas veguadas ha motz ramps, e majorment quan apar a la junctura del pe o en le pe, e veno a lu motz orrificis, e es yssit de quascu orrifici ram.	And this vein occasionally exhibits many knots, and mostly when it appears at the ankle joint or on the foot; many orifices emerge from it, and each orifice is known to produce a branch.
E donc cura aquela ayssi cum havem dit en la divisio e am aquo que es desus dit.	So treat it as we have described in the section above, and with what has been mentioned therein.
De sectione super vermes generatos sub cute et dicitur aegritudo bovina.	Regarding sections on worms generated beneath the skin, this condition is known as bovine sickness.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en alcuna terra deves nos malautia bovina per so quar motas veguadas endeve als bious e es verm pauc un le qual es nat entre la codena e la carn, e va en tot le cos pujan e devalan, e es mostrat al sentiment deves le sieu anament de membre en membre entro que disromp la codena e yeys fora.	Here is my translation of the text: 
E la generacio de lu es per putrefaccio de alcunas humors ayssi cum accideysso verms e serpentz e lombrics e ascaridas en le ventre.	Sure, here is my best attempt at translating this medieval medical text into English: 
E es temut per la malicia de lu, quar quan el va en le cors e es elevat al cap, e es pervengut al huel, lahoras fort leu uebre en lu e intra e destruzeys le huel, e aquo endeve motas veguadas.	Certainly! Here is my attempt at translating the provided text: 
E donc quan tu voles curar aquel e extraire lu, lahoras no se fa si no deves la sieua ambulacio e apparacio de lu al sentiment, e adonc cove que tu strenhas aquo que es sobre lu e aquo que es dejos lu am liament e constriccio fort, e aprop secca sobre lu e extratz aquel.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E si es preondat en la carn e no le atrobes, lahoras tu pausa cauteri am foc sobre le loc entro que mora, e la major causa que es temuda es corrupcio de lu am la qual corrump le loc ayssi cum havem dit.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text: 
May si tu vezes aquel esser pervengut al cap prop del huel, lahoras strenh sobre le sobrecil am fort strictura, e aprop secsa sobre lu, e extratz aquel; e cove que·l malaute use de mondificacio del sieu cors am medicinas evacuantz humors putridas malas, e guarda se de viandas generantz putrefaccio.	May you see the patient's condition reach the top of their head, then grasp the eyebrow with a strong grip and pull it out; afterward ensure that the patient undergoes body purification using medicines to evacuate unhealthy foul humours, and avoid foods that cause decay.
De sectione super aegritudinem nafir.	On treatment for nose ailments.
Aquesta malautia es nompnada en nostra terra nafir, e es dolor la qual ve en alcus membres, e aprop es permudada de membre en membre.	This ailment is called "nafir" in our region; it is a pain that moves from one body part to another.
E yeu ja e vista aquela segon que yeu te recomtare.	And I have seen the latter, which I will recount for you.
Yeu fu apelat a una femna malauta ad una vila, e descubric le sieu bras e vi una imflacio petita en la vena funis del bras, e pus que fu romas per una hora, vi aquela imflacio anar ayssi cum va verm pujan ad aquest, mays pus leugierament que esser por, ayssi cum si fos argent viu quan corr de loc en loc.	I was called to attend to a sick woman in a village; I examined her arm and noticed a small inflammation on the vein of her arm, which had remained stagnant for an hour, but then it started moving upwards like vermillion spreading across this space, more gently than fire would consume, as if it were liquid silver flowing from place to place.
E adonc anet s’en la dolor de aquel loc e fiquet se en le muscle, e aprop aqui stec per una hora.	Then the pain subsided from that spot and settled into her muscle; I stayed there for another hour.
E aprop correc en l’autre cors entro que pervenc al autre bras.	Afterward, it coursed through the rest of her body until it reached the other arm.
E aprop recomtec a mi que revolvia se per tot le cors sieu segon que yeu vi; e fo trop meravelat de la permutacio de lu e de la velocitat de membre en membre.	And I witnessed him writhing throughout his body as I observed; and I was greatly astonished by the interchangeability of his limbs and their velocity.
E yeu ja havia vist denant aquo en les mieus huels segon aquela manieyra, empero yeu he vistz motz les quals atroban dolor esser permutada de membra a membre.	I had previously witnessed this in my patients according to that manner, but I have seen many who find pain relief through the movement of their limbs.
Mays no vi aquo am les huels ayssi cum en la femna.	I have not observed this in my male patients as it occurs in females.
E yeu no cogiti esser aquo sino que es per aquo quar la femna era de viela, on so de secs cors e de venas descubertas, e en aquesta apparec al sentiment aquela ventositat permutada.	And I did not think this was anything other than what it is because the female patient was elderly, with thin skin and visible veins; in her, such movement of pain manifested itself.
E es necessari que no apparesca segon aquesta retro-curacio en aquels que son delicioses e am cors humitz de venas ameguadas.	It is important that this retro-curative approach not be utilized for those who are delicate and have moist skin with prominent veins.
E cum tu voles la curacio de lu, e le pacient sent aquela dolor, lahoras no es a tu aparent al huel ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras tu strenh sobre aquel e dejos lu leugierament e secse sobre aquel entro que sia yssida aquela ventositat coartada, e cauterize le loc.	And if you wish to cure the patient and they experience pain during treatment, but the issue is not as described above, then press firmly on them and lightly tap the area where the pain has shifted until it subsides; then cauterize that spot.
Mays si tu no la vezes am los tieus huels, alhoras tu cura aquel am excussio del cors e am aquo que expelleys ventositatz, e carmina aquelas am pillulas fetidas e am pillulas de serapi e semblantz.	But if you cannot identify the issue with your own eyes, then cure them by drawing out the humors from their body and through the expulsion of these winds; administer foul-smelling pills and pills made of serpent flesh or similar.
De extraccio de sagetas.	De extraccio de sagetas: The Extraction of Arrows.
Sagetas son diversificadas segon las specias, e segon les locs dels cors en les quals cazo, quar la lor diversitat es que de aquellas so que han grans puntas, e petitas, e concavas, e sordas, so es solidas; e de lor so que han tres angles, e de aquelas a las quals so que han lenguas; e de aquelas a las quals so astelas.	Sagetas (arrows) are diverse according to their types and the parts of the body they hit, for their diversity is such that some have large heads, others small ones, while yet other have concave or blunt ends, still others are solid; further there are those with three edges, as well as those which have barbs, and those which have feathers.
E aquela que es segon les membres e las pessas en las quals cazo es segon dos manieyras: quar les membres o so membres principals concaus, ayssi cum le cervel, le cor, e·l fitge, e le pulmo, e les ronhos, e les budels, e la vezica, e a lor semblantz; e donc quan catz en alcu de aquestz membres e aparo a tu senhals de mort, la qual causa yeu recomtare aprop, lahoras cove que tu evites extraccio de aquela sageta en aquels quar la mort siec aquel en le qual en las majors disposicios, e quan a tu no appareysso aquestz mals senhals, e la sageta no es amaguada en la profunditat del membre, lahoras tu extratz aquela e cura la plagua.	And the manner of extraction depends on which part of the body is affected: for some are vital parts like the brain, heart, liver, lungs, kidneys, intestines, bladder and their likes; if an arrow lodges in any of these parts and you perceive signs of death, which I shall describe below, then it is best to forego its extraction as this will only hasten death; but where no such symptoms are present and the arrow is not deeply embedded in a vital organ, then you may proceed with the extraction and treat the wound.
E dels senhals del servel es quan catz en lu sageta, e trespassa le os, e es yssit del cyphac le qual es sobre le cervel, quar accideys per lu soda vehement, e scotomia, e vertige, e rogor en les huels, e imflamacio e rogor de la lengua, e spasme e permixtio de entendament e vomi de colera, e fort leu es abscindida la paraula e es destruida la votz, e es yssit del loc de la plagua humiditat blanca semblant a pols, e yeys de lu semblant ad aquositat de la carn.	As for the signs pertaining to the brain: if an arrow pierces its bone and emerges from the crown of the head, this causes violent headaches, blindness, dizziness, pain in the eyes, inflammation and pain of the tongue, spasms, confusion, vomiting bile, severe impairment of speech, loss of voice; furthermore a white discharge oozes from the wound like dust, and the flesh around it appears watery.
E donc si appareyso a tu aquestz senhals, lahoras tu abste de la curacio e de la extraccio de la sageta, si non es fora.	And so if these signs appear to you, then you should refrain from the cure and extraction of the arrowhead, unless otherwise specified.
Mays les senhals de la sageta quan catz en le cor, so que ela es prop de la mamila senestra, e sent am aquela quays sia ficada en causa dura, e no es causa vueda; e fort leu le movement de la sageta es semblant a movement del pols, e corr de la plagua sanc negra, e siec aquel fregiditat de las extremitatz, e suzor freja, e sincopi; e donc sapias que la mort descen ses tot dopte.	But when the signs of the arrowhead being in the heart are as follows: it is close to the left nipple, and you feel that it has been embedded in hard tissue, not soft tissue; and its movement, if any, resembles that of the pulse, with dark-colored blood flowing out, along with coldness of the extremities, shallow breathing, and fainting spells; then know that death swiftly descends upon them.
E les senhals quan la sageta ha plaglat le pulmo so eyssiment de sanc spumos de la plagua, e les vayssels que so prop del col so apostematz, e es mudada la color del malaute, e expira sperit gran aut, e demanda atraccio de ayre freg.	And the signs when the arrowhead has pierced the lung are: foamy blood is issuing from the wound, the vessels near the neck have become inflamed, and the patient's complexion changes; they breathe heavily and deeply, as if drawing in cold air with great effort.
E si catz la sageta en le velament le qual es en le pietz, e la dolor lahoras es prop de las costas petitas, e es fayt le ale gran am vehement dolor e am sospir, e no so maugutz totz les membres dels muscles.	If the arrowhead has penetrated into the covering that is in the foot, and pain occurs nearby the small ribs, then a great outcry should be made with intense pain and gasping for breath, but there will not be paralysis of all the body's muscles.
E si catz la sageta en le stomac, lahoras fort leu yeys de la plagua vianda alcuna indigesta.	And if the arrowhead has entered the stomach, then quite likely some undigested food will emerge from the wound.
E si catz la sageta en le ventre, e es ficada en lu, yeys alcuna fenda de la plagua, o la tela, o budel le qual es disromput, e no es speransa en la curacio de lu extraccio de la sageta.	Here is the translation of your provided text:
E si la sageta catz en la vesica, e es yssida defora urina, e procesesca de lu alcuna causa a las partidas defora, e fort leu es dolor sobre le malaute, lahoras sapias que es mortal.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
Mays les autres membres ayssi cum es la cara, le col, e·l golayro, e las spallas e le adjutori, e les spondils del dos, e la furcula, e la coysa, e la camba e a lor semblantz dels membres, son salvatz segon las majors disposicios quan la sageta no atroba vena ni arteria e no es sageta venenosa.	Moreover, other body parts such as the face, neck, throat, shoulders, vertebrae of the back, ribs, hip bone, thigh, and similar areas are treated according to established practice when the arrowhead has not pierced a vein or artery and is not a poisoned arrow.
E yeu recomtare aquo a tu que he vist del esser de aquestas sagetas, per que signifiques per aquo sobre la curacio tieua.	And I will recount this to you about the nature of these arrowheads so that you may know how to treat them.
La qual causa es, quar en un home cazec sageta en le lacrimal del huel de lu en la razitz del nas, e yeu extrayssi aquela a lu del autra partida, dejos le grays de l’aurelha de lu, e es sanat, e no accidic en le huel de lu nocument.	The reason for this is that in the case of an arrowhead lodged in a man's tear duct near his nose, I extracted it from him on the opposite side, leaving a wound behind his ear, and he healed without any harm coming to his eye.
E extrayssi autra sageta a un Juzeu la qual cazec en lu en lo grays del sieu huel, dejos la palpebra pus dejos, e la sageta ja era occultada e no so conseguit de aquela sino una petita extremitat am la qual adhereys al sieu fust, e era gran sageta de las sagetas agudas dels Turcs , am ferr leon en la qual no havia aurelhas.	I extracted another arrowhead from a Jew who had been shot in the socket of his eye, just below the eyelid, where the arrowhead was already hidden and could only be grasped by its small tip that remained attached to its shaft. This was one of those long, sharp arrows used by the Turks with a lion emblazoned on it but without ears.
E senat es le Juzieu , e no accidic en le sieu huel mal accident.	The Jew is healed, and his eye suffered no harm.
E extrayssi una autra sageta a un home Crestia la qual era cazuta en le golayro, e era sageta arabica, e es aquela a la qual so aurelhas; e adonc yeu inscidegui sobre aquela entre doas guidegi, e ja era submersa en le golayro de lu; e adonc yeu so subtiliat am aquela, e aprop extraxi aquela, e es sanat le Crestia .	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E extraxi autra sageta a un home la qual era cazuta en le sieu ventre, e cogitegui que moris per aquela; e donc, pus que foro passatz xxx dias e no es mudat sobre lu alcuna causa de las suas disposicios, inscidegui sobre la sageta e engenagui sobre aquela, e es sanat, e no accidic a lu accident mal.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E vi mays un home en le qual cazec una sageta en le dos de lu, e consolidada es la plagua sobre lu, e pus que foc aprop set ans, yssic la sageta en la razitz de la coyssa.	And there was a man in whom an arrow had pierced his back, and the wound has become hardened on him with suppuration for nearly seven years now, until the arrow came out at the hollow of his hip.
E vi una femna a la qual cazec sageta en le sieu ventre, e la plagua es consolidada dedintz lu, e no es mudada en las suas disposicios en re, e la femna no atrobec nocument en alcunas de las suas opperacios naturals.	I saw a woman in whom an arrow had pierced her belly, and the wound is hardened inside her, with no change to its appearance over time, and the woman does not suffer any harm or obstruction in her natural functions.
E vi un autre home al qual cazec sageta en la sua cara e consolidada es la plagua e romas la sageta, no atrobant aqui mota dolor, e motz semblantz ad aquestz.	I observed another man in whom an arrow had pierced his face and the wound has healed but broken open again as if the arrow is still there, causing him no pain, with many similarities to the previous cases.
E extrayssi la sageta del home dels princeps del rey que era cazuda en le mieg loc del nas sieu e ja havia declinat a la partida dreyta un petit, e occultada era tota la sageta.	I extracted the arrow from the nose of the king's chief minister, which had entered just between his eyebrows and slightly inclined towards the right side; the entire arrow was hidden within.
E yeu fu appelat a la curacio de lu aprop le cazement de la sageta entro a tres dias.	I was summoned for his treatment only three days after the injury occurred.
E adonc yeu atrobegui la plagua de la sageta mot streyta; e adonc yeu inquirigui aquela am tenta subtil, e no sentigui aquela; mays el la sentia puncio dejos la aurelha dreyta, e adonc speregui que aquela punccio era per la extremitat de la sageta.	Then I closely examined the wound to try and locate the arrow, but I could not find it; however, he felt a pricking sensation just beneath his right ear, which led me to believe that this was due to the tip of the arrow.
E amplastregui le loc am emplaustre en le qual es vertut atrectiva e digestiva, confizant de mi que·l loc se apostemes per que appares a mi le loc de la sageta, per que secces sobre aquela.	And cover the area with a plaster that has attractive and digestive virtues, trusting in me that the place will become infected so that the wound appears to me, so I can dry it.
E no accidic en le loc accident significant que la sageta hagues conseguit aquel loc; e yeu continuegui am le emplaustre sobre lu per motz dias e no accidic accident; e consolidada es la plagua entretant, e romas le malaute de la extreccio de lu per spazi de motz dias entro que un jorn sentic la sageta dintz le sieu nas e recontec aquo a mi.	And do not make a mistake in assuming that the arrow has reached this place; I will continue with the plaster on it for many days and no accident happens; meanwhile, the wound is healed, and the patient recovers from their extraction over several days until one day they felt the arrow inside their nose and told me about it.
E adonc yeu pausegui sobre la plagua medicina acuta corrosiva per motz dias entro que foc ubert, e am la tenta yeu assagegui aquel, e atrobegui la extremitat de la sageta subtil, la qual adhereys al fust.	Then I placed sharp corrosive medicine on the wound for many days until it opened, and with a hook, I tried to grab it, but only found the tip of the arrow, which was stuck to the shaft.
E aprop yeu ajustegui en la apersio de la plagua per aquela medicina acuta entro que apparec a mi visiblament la extremitat de la sageta, e passec a mi temps am aquo per le spazi de temps entro quatre meses.	Then I poured the sharp corrosive medicine into the wound until I could clearly see the tip of the arrow, and this process took place over four months.
E aprop pus que la plagua foc amplificada, e foc a mi possible entrometre las forfexs en lu, e remaure aquela, e no obezic ad eyssiment, lahoras yeu no cessegui subtiliar e ingeniar sobre aquela am manieyras de engen, entro que comensegui un dia sobre aquela am manieyras de engens pendre lu am forceps descentment faytas, segon que vindra la forma de aquelas en la fi del capitol, entro que extraxi aquela; e aprop restauregui aquela plagua.	And since the wound was enlarged, it became possible for me to insert the scissors into it, and I removed the tip of the arrow that remained inside. However, I could not extract the rest, so I did not stop trying different methods and tools until one day I managed to design a pair of forceps specifically tailored for this purpose, as will be described later in this chapter, and successfully extracted the arrow; then I treated the wound.
E alcus metges jutgavan que la cartillage del nas no es restaurada, e yeu restauregui aquela e la plagua es consolidada, e sanat es le malaute per sanetat entiera, e no noguec en lu en deguna causa.	Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E yeu recomti a tu la qualitat de extraccio de alcunas sagetas per que pauses aquo regla e significacio sobre aquo que no he dit, quar las partidas de aquesta art e las difinicios de aquela no so conprehendudas am narracio ni no comprehen aquelas le libre.	Here is my best attempt at translating the provided text into English:
E le artifexs savi compara am pauc sobre mot; e am aquo que es present sobre aquo que es absent; e atroba operacio novela e instrument novel deves le descendement de las causas extranhas del art quan accideysso.	Here is my best translation of the given text: 
E donc yeu dic que sagetas no son fora-gitadas dels membres en les quals son ficadas sino segon dos manieyras: o per atraccio del loc en le qual intrec; o per le contrari de la autra partida.	And so, I say that arrows are not removed from the members in which they are embedded but rather according to two methods: either by attraction from the place where it enters or by pressure from the opposite side.
E aquela que es gitada per le loc don es intrada, o es sageta procedent en loc carnos, e es atirada e fora-gitada.	And the one that is removed by attracting it from the entry point may be an arrow that has hit a fleshy area and been drawn out.
E si no obezeys a eyssiment de la hora en la qual catz, lahoras cove que tu la laysses per alcus dias entro que poyresca la carn que es al enviro de lu, e sia alleujada l‘atraccio de lu e la sua egressio.	If it does not obey the attempt to extract at this moment, then you must leave it for a few days until the flesh around it swells and is loosened from its attraction and its exit.
E semblantment si es ficada en os e no obezeys a tu a eyssiment, lahoras layssa aquela per alcus dias e itera aquela am atraccio e mocio en quascun dia, e ja es fora-gitada.	Similarly, if it is embedded in bone and does not yield to your extraction attempt, then leave it for a few days and try again with traction and movement each day until it is removed.
E si no obezeys a tu eyssiment aprop alcus dias, lahoras cove que tu perforas en le circuit de la sageta en aquel os de tota partida am taravel subtil entro que·l loc sia amplificat de la sageta, e aprop extratz aquela.	And if it does not yield to your attempts after a few days, then you must drill into the path of the arrow in that bone from both sides with a fine borer until the area is widened around the arrow, and then extract it.
E si la sageta es ficada en le os del cap e ja ha procezit en un dels ventres del cervel, e apparo en le malaute alcus de aquels accidentz les quals yeu e ditz, lahoras abste de la extraccio de la sageta e layssa aquela entro que·l sieu esser sia equat aprop alcus dias; quar si la sageta perve al ciphac, lahoras la mort no es a lu prolonguada.	And if the arrow is lodged in the bone of the skull and has pierced into one of the ventricles of the brain, and the patient exhibits some of those accidents I have mentioned above, then refrain from extracting the arrow and leave it until his condition becomes equal for several days; for if the arrow pierces the membrane, then death will not be prolonged.
E si la sageta no es ficada sino en le cors del os tant solament e no passa entro al ciphac, e roman le malaute per alcus dias, e no accideys a lu denguna causa de aquels accidentz, lahoras tu engenia en la atraccio de la sageta e en la atraccio de lu.	Here is my attempt at translating the text: 
Mays si es mot ficada e no obezeys a tu a extraccio, lahoras tu aministra taravels en le circuit de la sageta ayssi cum havem recomtat, e aprop cura le loc entro que sia sanat.	But if it is deeply embedded and does not obey your extraction attempt, then you administer hot irons around the arrow's path as we have recommended, and then treat the area until it is healed.
Mays si la sageta ja es amaguada en le loc del cors, e es amaguada del sentiment, lahoras tu inquireys aquela am tenta, e si tu sentas aquela, lahoras atira aquela am alcus sturmentz les quals so convenientz a la atraccio de lu.	But if the arrow has already penetrated the chest cavity and is hidden from sight, you must probe for it carefully with your hands or some other suitable tool, and when you find it, then draw it out with appropriate instruments.
E si no podes sobre lu per la constriccio de la plagua e per la longitut del preon, e aqui no es os ni nervi ni vena, lahoras tu fen sobre la plagua entro que sia amplificada e que sia possible extrayre la sageta.	And if you cannot operate on the patient due to the restricted access caused by swelling and the length of the arrowhead, there being neither a vein nor nerve involved, then you should make an incision in such a way as to widen the wound so that the arrow may be extracted.
E si so a lu aurelhas am las quals sia tenguda, lahoras tu deliura la carn en la qual es ficada de tota partida am tot le engen que poyras far; e ingenia sobre aquo, si no podes sobre la evasio de la carn en la fractura de las aurelhas e en torssio de aquelas entro que obezesca.	And if they have an arrow in their ear and you hold it there, then release the flesh into which it is embedded from all around with as much skill as you can muster; and devise some plan for this, such that if you cannot free the flesh at the fracture of the ears or if they twist, they will obey.
E quan tu administras la extraccio de la sageta en quascun loc on sia, lahoras tu usa am torcio de la tua ma am forceps a totas partidas entro que fassa aquela obezir; e subtilia am deriera subtilitat que la sageta no sia trencada e que sia fayta a tu dificil atraccio de lu e de aquela extraccio.	When you perform the extraction of the arrow from any location, use your hand in such a way as to twist and apply forceps all around so that it obeys; and be gentle yet firm so that the arrow is not broken nor do you make its removal difficult for yourself.
E si no podes sobre aquela de la tua hora, lahoras tu layssa per alcus dias entro que se poyrescan las partidas que so en le circuit de lu, e aprop itera aquela quar lahoras es alleujada.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
Mays si a tu fa contrarietat flux de sanc, lahoras tu administra aquo que havem dit de curacio en le sieu capitol.	If you find that bleeding causes discomfort to the patient, then apply the treatments we have discussed in this chapter.
E guarda la tua vertut de inscizio de vena o de nervi, o de corda, e aministra engen en tota manieyra a tu possibla de la evasio de la sageta; e fay aquo am facilitat e tranquillitat e tarditat e fermetat ayssi cum yeu e a tu recomtat.	Take heed of your skill in incising veins, nerves, or cords, and manage any accidental arrow injuries with all the means at your disposal to avoid further harm; do so with ease, calmness, speed, and firmness, as I have instructed you.
E donc que fassas contrayre la sageta per so que·l malaute sia segon la figura segon la qual foc deves le cazement de la sageta en lu, quar es mays juvatiu.	Therefore, press against the arrow in a way that aligns with the figure showing the direction of its entrance into the body; this is most beneficial for the patient.
Mays si aquo no es a tu possible, lahoras tu aministra aquo que es a tu possible per las figuras.	If that is not feasible for you, then apply the treatment that is within your capabilities based on the figures provided.
Mays las sagetas que son fora-gitadas per le contrari del autra partida, o que ja de lu procezeys alcuna partida a las partidas de fora, o fa gilbositat la extramitat de la sageta per sentiment de la partida pus desus de la codena propdana e vezes aquela eminent; adonc tu secsa sobre aquela; e sia la seccio segon la quantitat en la qual prenguan las forceps; e aprop atira aquela, quar ela es fayta leugiera a eyssiment.	For arrows that have bent outwards due to the opposing force of another part, or those that have already caused some damage to the surrounding parts and have become embedded in the flesh with their tips visible above the wound; you must cut off the tip using scissors according to its size. Then pull it out, as this is a gentle process.
Mays si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu tortz lama segon contrarietat entro que la sageta enprema en le os, e amplifique a si meteys, e aprop extratz aquela.	If the arrow is lodged in the bone, you must twist it gently in an opposite direction until it releases from the bone and can be extracted.
E sino, layssa aquela per alcus dias, e aprop itera aquela entro qu’en yesca.	And if not, leave her there for a few days, then repeat the process until it succeeds.
E si le fust de la sageta es en aquela, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am lu.	And if the shaft of the arrow is inside her, then you need to push it out.
Mays si le fust es cazut e voles aministrar inpulsio, lahoras tu intromet e aquela, si es sorda, sturment concau per so que intre la concavitat de lu en la coa de la sageta e aprop impelleys aquela am lu.	However, if the shaft has fallen out and you need to administer a push, then introduce a concave instrument into her if she is unconscious, ensuring it fits over the tail of the arrow, and then push the shaft out.
Mays si la sageta es concava, lahoras tu impelleys aquela am sturment fort intrant en aquela, quar la sageta es alleujada per aquela.	But if the arrow is concave, you will need to push it out with a strong instrument that enters her deeply, as the arrowhead is relieved by this.
E si la sageta es entoxiguada, lahoras cove que tu concaves tota la carn en la qual es le vere, si es a tu possible aquo, e aprop cura aquela am aquo que si conveneys.	And if the arrow is envenomed, you must ensure that you hollow out all of the flesh surrounding the wound, if it is at all possible to do so, and then treat her with whatever seems appropriate.
E si la sageta catz en le pietz, o en le ventre, o en la vesica, o en le costat, e es propinqua per so que tu tocas aquela am la tenta, e es a tu possible secsar sobre aquela, lahoras secsa sobre aquela e guarda te de inscizio de vena o de nervi, e extratz aquela, e aprop cos la plagua si indigeys, e cura aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the arrow has penetrated the foot or the abdomen or bladder or side, and it is close enough that you can feel it with a rod, and it is at all possible to do so, then saw through the flesh surrounding it and remove the arrowhead, taking care not to cut any veins or nerves. Suture the wound if necessary and treat her until she is healed.
Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:	Forma de forceps am las quals so atiradas las sagetas:

De fleubotomia de las venas.	De fleubotomia de las venas.
Las venas de fleubotomia de las quals corr costuma de fleubotomar so xxx, de las quals so en le cap xvi, so es doas venas pulsatils las quals so aprop las aurelhas, dic alhasisain; doas herbas que so en les dos templars apparentz; e doas venas que so en dos lacrimals de dos huels que son appeladas aspicientz; e la vena preparada en le mieg loc del front, e la vena que es en la extremitat del nas; e doas guidegi que so al col; e doas venas que so en la labia desus; e doas venas que so en la labia dejos; e — aquestas so las venas que so appeladas algelic —; e so doas venas que so dejos la lengua. Mays las venas que so fleubotomadas en les brasses so v; quar de aquelas es una cephalica, e es deves le latz silvestre; e le poble appela “la vena del cap”, e sorda, e es vena migiera, e es composta de un ram de la basilica, e de autre ram de la cephalica; e nomna aquela le poble “vena de tot le cors”, e basilica es vena la qual es pausada en le latz domestic, e es nomnada “citillar”, e nompnan aquela les vulguars “vena del ventre”; e funis del bras, e es pausada sobre le focil, e es aquela en la qual es fleubotomat, e es aquela que appar sobre le poutz per apparicio manifesta; e salvatella, e es la vena que es entre lo dit auricular e·l pus petit dit, e so en lu dos ramps.
