Sanguissuguas no so administradas en motz membres sino en les membres en les quals non es possible posicio de ventosas, per la parvitat de aquels, ayssi cum le pot e gingiva e semblantz a lor; o en membre denudat de carn, ayssi cum le dit e·l nas e lors semblantz.	Leeches should not be applied to many body parts but only to those areas where cupping is impossible due to their small size, such as the palms of the hands and soles of the feet, or to a part deprived of flesh like the nose and its similar appendages." 
E la qualitat de usar de aquelas que si has trobadas sanguisugas que so en las ayguas dossas de poyredura mundas.	And when it comes to using leeches, find those that are located in clean waters free of any corruption.
E aprop sian layssadas le dia e la nueyt en aygua dossa entro que sian famolentas, e que no romangua alcuna causa en le ventre de aquelas; e aprop sia evacuat le cors en le comensament am fleubotomia e am ventozas; e aprop fregua le membre del malaute entro que s’enrojezesca; e aprop sian pausadas sobre lu.	Then let them be immersed day and night in clean water until they are completely famished, ensuring there is no remaining food in their stomachs. Next, evacuate the body through venesection (fleubotomia) and cupping (ventozas), then rub the patient's limb(s) until it reddens, finally placing the leeches upon them.
E cum son umplidas e caso.	And when they are full (with blood), remove them.
E si es possible succio del loc am ventoza, es mays derier en juvament.	If it is possible to extract more blood from the area with cupping (ventoza), then this will be of further benefit.
E sino, lahoras lava le loc am vi agre e aprop am mota aygua; e sia freguat e expremut.	Otherwise, wash the area with vinegar, followed by warm water; then rub it (gently) and wring it out.
E si es prolonguat le cors del sanc aprop le cazement de las sanguissuguas, e es aquo resudan, lahoras tu enfon un drap de li en aygua freja, e pausa aquel de sobre entro que sia abdida la resudacio.	And if the blood continues to flow from the wound after removal of the leeches, then you place a cloth soaked in cold water over it until the bleeding has ceased.
E si le sanc es multiplicat, lahoras polveriza sobre lu vitriol trissat, o guallas e semblantz a lor de las causas stipticas, entro que·l sanc sia abscidit; o sian pausadas sobre le loc las maytatz de favas excocicadas, e sian layssadas entro que las favas aderescan al loc, e es le sanc abscidit.	If the blood flow increases, then apply a powder of pulverized vitriol, or other substances with similar styptic properties to stem the bleeding; alternatively, place cooked bean husks on it and leave them until the beans adhere to the area.
E cove, si es necessaria, iteracio de sanguissuguas, quan es possible mudar aquelas.	And now, if it is necessary, repeat the bloodletting with leeches, when it is possible to change them.
E si las sanguissuguas son prohibidas de suspenssio, lahoras sia freguat le loc am sanc recent o fique una agulha en les locs entro que yesca sanc; e aprop sian pausadas, quar aquelas quan sento alcun sanc tantost adarysso.	And if the use of leeches is prohibited due to their suspension, then rub the area with fresh blood or insert a needle into those places until blood flows out; and once they are placed, they will immediately increase (the flow) as soon as they sense some blood.
E quan voles que cajan, polveriza sobre aquelas un pauc de aloen trissat, o sal, o cendre, e cazo tantost.	And when you want them to stop (bleeding), sprinkle a little powdered aloe over them, or salt, or ashes, and it will stop immediately.
Ayssi comensa lo prolec de la tersa partida: de restauracio.	This begins the third part of the treatment: restoration.
Aquest capitol es motas veguadas necessari en la art de medicina; e es restauracio de fractura e de dislocacio accident en les osses.	This chapter is very important to see in the art of medicine; it is about restoring fractures and accidental dislocations of bones.
O, filh, sapiatz que jactan se de aquest capitol les fols metges e les vulguars e aquels que degun temps no reguardero les libres dels Antics ni legiro de aquels una letra.	Oh, my child, know that this chapter is disregarded by foolish doctors and common people, as well as those who have never spent time studying the books of the Ancients nor read a single letter from them.
E per aquesta causa es fayt que aquesta manieyra dels scients in terra nostra es privat; e yeu no ho e obliat en aquo degun temps be de tot; e no he adhibit aquo que apres, sino per longitut de lectio dels libres dels Antics e studi sobre le entendement de aquels, entro que extrayssi la sciencia de aquels.	And it is for this reason that the way of the knowledgeable is hidden in our land; and I have never forgotten anything from all those good times studying; and I have not added what I learned, but only through a long reading of the books of the Ancients and my study over their understanding, which allowed me to extract science from them.
E aprop adirigui a experiment e studi en la longitut de la mieua vida.	And then I devoted myself to experience and study throughout my life.
E yeu ja he de aquo descrit en aquest capitol tot aquo que conte la mieua sciencia e sobre le qual es passat lo mieu experiment; pus que agui abreujat aquo a vos autres e deliuregui aquo de occupacio de elonguacio; e abreujegui aquo en la fi de abreujacio; et e monstrat aquo en la fi de declaracio; e formegui en aquo motas formas dels sturmentz que so administratz en aquel, cum es fayt per addicio de declaracio, ayssi cum he fayt en dos capitols precedentz.	I have already described in this chapter everything that encompasses my knowledge and all the matters on which I have experimented; since there is an abridgment of these to you others and it frees them from prolixity; I have abbreviated this at the end as an abridgment, and have shown it at the end by a declaration. And I will form in this notes about the forms of the instruments that are applied here, as it was made by addition of a declaration, thus having done so in two preceding chapters.
Capitol primier.	Chapter One.
Summae et collectiones ex esse fracturae ossium, ex eis quarum praemissio necessaria est, antequam incipiamus rememorationem membrorum fraftorum et diversorum si uniuscuiusque.	Sums and collections about bone fractures, among those things whose introduction is necessary before we begin the recollection of broken limbs and their diverse kinds.
Cove donc que diguam en le prohemi de aquest capitol las summas del sermo; e les capitols al entendament dels quals en le comensament es forsat le artifexs e a stacio sobre la veritat de aquels; so es vos e aquels que so promptz que sapian o aprenguan aquesta art nobla autres de vos.	Therefore, let us say in the prologue of this chapter some summations of our speech, and also the chapters to which the master craftsmen's attention is drawn at the beginning, as a kind of station on the truth of these matters; it is you and those who are ready that know or learn this noble art from among yourselves.
E donc dic que quan accideys a alcu fractura o dislocacio o torcio o cazement, lahoras cove que tu te coytes al comensament am fleubotomia o aleyar aquel, o quascu ensemps, si no prohibeys alcuna causa, ayssi cum debelitat de vertut, o es aquel al qual accideys effant, o viel en decrepitat, o es temps de vehement calor, o de vehement freg.	Here is my translation of the provided text:
E aprop sia content en vianda sieua de erbas frejas e de carns de auzels e de crabotz; e prohibem carns grossas e umplir si de viandas e de tota vianda que umple las venas de sanc, entro que siras segurat de apostema caut, e si no temes efusio de materia al membre.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E lahoras retorne le malaute al sieu regiment primier am le qual corr costuma de lu.	And then return the patient to their previous regimen with what they are accustomed to eating.
E donc cum le os trencat comensa esser restaurat, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia pascut de viandas nutritivas de nutriment mot e gros e greu en les quals sia viscositat, ayssi cum so viandas faytas de froment cueyt am aygua, e ris, e caps, e pes, e ventres de vacas, e huous, e peys fresc, e vi gros e semblants ad aquels, e am aquest regiment es fayta coagulacio de fractura pus leugierament e miels.	And when the broken bone begins to heal, it is necessary for the patient to be fed with nutritious foods that are heavy and rich in nutrients, such as porridge made of dry wheat with water, rice, beans, peas, cow's stomachs, eggs, fresh fish, red wine, and similar items. With this regimen, fracture coagulation occurs more quickly and effectively.
E sapias que les osses trinquatz quan so en les homes que so en la primiera vilura e en los decrepitz, no es possible que sian continuatz e sian consolidatz segon lur natura per la exsiccacio dels membres de lor.	And know that broken bones in men who are either in their first stage of life or old and frail cannot be completely healed and restored to their natural state due to the dryness of their body parts.
E son consolidatz e continuatz segon lor natura tot temps per la exsiccacio de aquels membres, e so continuatz e consolidatz aquels que so de lor en la fi de la lenitat, ayssi cum les osses dels petitz effantz.	They are consolidated and restored to their natural state permanently due to the dryness of those body parts; they remain intact and strong at the end of healing, just like the bones of young children.
Mays empero natura ajusta e amnecteys sobre le os trencat de tota partida alcuna causa semblant a glut en le qual es grossitut que adhereys e strenh aquel entro que so ensemps conglutinatz e liatz ensemps, entro que venen la fi de fortitut e de fermesa, ayssi cum foc al comensament, entro que denguna causa no prohibeys aquel de las suas obres.	However, nature adjusts and provides nourishment to the broken bone by means of a substance similar to glue, which makes it adhere and bind together what was previously separate and fragmented. This is when strength and firmness return at last, just like fire initially, so that nothing prevents it from doing its work.
E per aquesta causa es necessari que pauses las viandas del malaute, viandas en las quals so gravitat e viscozitat e grosseza, ayssi cum havem dit.	And for this reason, it is necessary that you provide the patient with food and drink which has gravity, viscosity, and thickness, as we have mentioned before.
Mota diversitat de fractura segon diversitat del membre.	There is a variety of fractures depending on the different parts of the body.
E sapias que las specias de fractura son diversas segon la diversitat dels membres, quar fractura del os de la camba es diversa de la fractura del os del cap; e la fractura del os del pietz es divers de la fractura del os del dos; e semblantment totz les autres membres son diverses entre lor.	And know that the types of fractures are diverse depending on the variety of body parts, for a fracture in the leg bone is different from one in the skull bone; similarly, a fracture in the foot bone differs from that in the spine; and likewise, all other body parts vary from each other.
E yeu venc am rememoracio de tota specia de fractura, expausada en le sieu capitol distincta del autre.	I want a recollection of every type of fracture, expanded upon in its own distinct chapter.
Mota diversitat de fractura en si meteyssa.	There is also diversity within each type of fracture itself.
E son diversificadas las specias de fractura del os en lor meteyssas; quar es fayta fractura arcuada otra aquo que accidan en lu stellas; e alcunas veguadas es fayta fractura segon la longitut del os: e so las fracturas de lu satagia e astelhas e addicios procedentz e no-procedentz, ayssi cum es fayt en la pena quan es preparada a escriure, e es fractura am plagua e disrupcio en le cap, e es fractura fissura petita.	The types of fractures are further diversified within themselves; for instance, there is the curved fracture and another one that occurs in stars; some depend on the length of the bone, such as the fracture of the shaft, head, articular and non-articular processes; it's like when a pen is prepared to write but breaks instead, or there are fractures with wounds, disruption in the skull, and small fissures.
E a tota specia es engen o turment propri en restauracio de lu segon que vindra rememoracio de lu distincta en les sieus locs.	And this whole procedure is designed as an appropriate torture during recovery, which will be recalled distinctly in their specific places.
Mota senhal de fractura del os.	Signs of bone fracture.
E per aquo es conoguda fractura del os: es tortuositat de lu, e de aquel eminencia e appericio de lu al sentiment, e so de lu quan compremes aquel am la tua ma.	And it is known as a bone fracture because of the bending of the limb and that bulge becomes apparent to touch; moreover when you compress it with your hand.
E donc quan no es en le loc tortuositat apparent ni so no es feyt deves le tieu tocament quan toques le os am agitacio e le malaute no atroba gran dolor, lahoras no es aqui fractura.	And when there is no visible bending in the limb and upon touching the bone with agitation, the patient does not feel great pain, then it is not a fracture.
Habantz es possible que sia tortuositat o petita fissura, adon no cove que tu mauguas aquel am la tua ma e am compressio de tot; habantz pausa sobre lu de las medicinas de las quals ve rememoracio aprop aquel moment le qual conveneys al loc; e aprop sia streyt per strictura subtil.	However, there could be a bending or small fissure present where you shouldn't press too much with your hand and with compression all around; instead apply the appropriate medicine that you will recall at that very moment which suits this place best; and then bind it tightly with subtle pressure.
E sapias que·l loc quan es arcuat e no es scindit en dos o otra aquo que no accidan en lu satagie, cum es remauguda tota partida de la sua compar, lahoras cove que comenses de la tua hora a rectificacio de lu habantz que a lu accida apostema caut.	And know that when the affected area is curved and not split into two or another thing which does not happen often, like when the entire part of its body swells up, then you must start immediately to straighten it before an abscess forms.
E si a lu accida apostema caut, lahoras layssa aquel per alcus dias entro que cesse le apostema; e aprop engualha aquel segon quascuna manieyra que podes de levitat e de engen.	And if the patient has an abscess in the groin, then leave it be for a few days until the abscess subsides; then dress it according to your best ability and ingenuity.
E sapias que restauracio de lu e agulacio de lu es pus leugiera que del os en le qual accideysso sathagie.	Remember that the restoration of the patient's health and their recovery is more important than the severity of the disease.
E aprop strenh aquel segon que vindra la rememoracio de lu.	Then strengthen the patient according to when they will be able to remember what has happened to them.
Mays si en le os so satagias, lahoras es necessaria extencio de aquest membre trencat de doas partz, si es la ma o le pe; o am la tua ma si le membre es petit; o am doas cordas o am una corda e la ma.	But if the disease reaches the bone, then it is necessary to extend this broken member in two parts, be it an arm or a leg; use your hand if the member is small; or use two cords or one cord and your hand.
E sia la tua posicio am la qual pauses le membre loc engual segon la sua figura natural, mentre que las partidas so extandudas del membre trenquat, lahoras te perforsa que fassas retornar aquelas addicios am engen e segon quascuna manieyra que poyras en lor locs.	And make sure your position is such that you place the member in its natural shape while the separated parts of the broken member are extended; then you must skillfully and ingeniously join these additions back together.
E guarda te segon la tua forssa que no accida sobre le malaute per la tua operacio delor ni lesio; e perforsa te segon le tieu poder que tu appliques la un os am l’autre son companho segon lors milhors formas.	Watch yourself according to your strength so that you do not cause the patient more pain or injury due to your operation; and make sure, as much as it is in your power, that you place one bone against its companion according to their best shapes.
E cove que en aquela hora aprofitablament tu toques am la tua ma aquel, e si vezes aqui alcuna causa diversa, rectifiqua aquel e enguala aquel per la quantitat de la tua vertut.	And now it is necessary for you to touch him with your hand at that very moment, and if you find any other cause, rectify it and adjust it according to the extent of your ability.
E exquiva vehement extenssio e compressio, ayssi cum fan mots fols metges que motas veguadas fan accidir apostema caut per la sua operacio, o fan accidir contraccio en le membre ayssi cum havem vist aquo per la operacio de lor motas veguadas.	Avoid violent extension and compression, just as foolish doctors do who cause abscesses by their treatment or bring about contraction in the limb, which we have seen happen due to their unskilled operations.
E aprop annecteys, aprop equacio e decent operacio e strictura de aquel membre, e repaus e tranquilitat; amoneste le malaute sobre aquo e fay le squivar que no maugua aquel en la hora de las suas vigilias e del sieu dormir, e ves la sua revolucio e agitacio, e deves la sua egestio, e deves totz les sieus movementz am tota la sua vertut; e aguarda se que la posicio del membre sia posicio am la qual sia asegurada la dolor, la qual causa es quar quan sent en la disposicio de la posicio del membre delor o lesio; lahoras cove que permutes aquel ad autra disposicio de aquela am la qual non senta dolor; e guarda am aquo que la posicio de lu aquela sia dreyta e engual, per so que al membre non accida tortuositat quan es restaurat.	Then proceed with the connection, equalization, and careful treatment and binding of that limb, ensuring rest and tranquility; instruct the patient about this and make him avoid harming it during his wakefulness or sleep, observing any changes in its condition; you should also control all his movements using your entire power; keep an eye out to see if the limb's position is one where pain or injury are likely to occur, since sometimes when a limb feels pain or sustains damage, it needs to be moved into another position that does not cause pain. You must ensure that the patient maintains this new position in such a way as to prevent deformity once healing has taken place.
E la qualitat de la strictura del membre tranquat es aquela que yeu recomti; per que sapias que·ls membres trencatz so diversificatz en lor parvitat e en lor grandeza e en la forma de aquels.	The kind of binding I recommend for a broken limb is as follows: understand that fractures vary according to the size, weight, and shape of the different limbs.
E de aquels que son petits ayssi cum le bras e·l dit e·l focil e semblantz ad aquels, lahoras cove que la envolucio sia de drap mol subtil.	And for those who are very small like the arm and forearm and similar to these, it is appropriate that the wrapping be made of very fine cloth.
Mays aquels que so grosses ayssi cum la cuoyssa o la camba, cove que en aquels sia envolucio lada e dura, quar la liadura lada connecteys le membre gran e strenh aquel de tota part am strictura engual, enayssi que en lu no intre macula.	For those who are overweight and large like the thigh or leg, it is necessary that their wrapping be made of thick and stiff material. The tight binding connects a large and strong member with constriction on all sides so that nothing foul enters them.
E aprop comensa, aprop la tua evacuacio de equacio, pausar liament convenient ad aquo, sobre le loc de aquela fractura am tres envolucios o quatre segon que·l membre mereys; e strenh la tua ma un petit am le liament.	Then begin, immediately start your evacuation process by placing appropriate padding suited to the situation over the site of fracture using three wraps or four according to how much you think the member deserves; bind your hand tightly with a small bandage.
E aprop ve am aquel a la partida pus sobirana del loc de la fractura, e strenh mens que no foc la tua strictura am la qual has strengut le loc de la fractura.	And now turn to the most important part of the fracture site and bind less tightly than you did when binding the site so as not to impede blood flow.
E aprop elongua te am envolucio del loc de la fractura un pauc, e mollifiqua la strictura petit a petit, entro que prenguas del loc sa una gran partida.	Then extend the wrapping from the fracture site a little, gradually loosening the binding as you take away an important part of it.
E aprop pren una autra benda e envolveys aquela autra veguada sobre le loc trenquat am envolucio, e aprop ve am las envolucios a la partida pus dejos de la fractura; e sia la tua operacio en la strictura de la envolucio e en mollificacio de aquela segon que havem dit en la envolucio primieyra desus.	Now take another bandage and wrap it around this other side over the area previously wrapped, then go to the wraps at the bottom of your fracture; let your operation be in binding the wrap and loosening it as we mentioned before with the first wrap above.
E aprop pausa entre las volucios de stopa leon o drap am le qual sia engualada la tortuositat de la fractura, si en lu es tortuositat; e sino, no pauses en lu alcuna causa.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aprop pausa sobre lu autra benda, e aprop enguala sobre aquestas envolucios stelhas decentment faytas tantost, si en le loc no es imflacio o apostema caut, e lahoras pausa sobre lu aquo que sede le apostema aquel e que oste la imflacio; e layssa aquela per alcus jorns; e lahoras tu strenh sobre lu las stelhas.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:	E sian las stelhas de la maytat de canna lada raza, e be formada saviament; o sian de fust de pi; o de ramps de palma ; e sia le ample de quascuna stelha segon aquesta forma e aquesta figura:
Empero cove que la astelha que es pausada sobre aquela fractura sia pus grossa e pus lada un petit que las autras astelhas, e la longitut de la stela segon qu’es legut al membre en magnitut e parvitat; e aprop strenh sobre las astelhas am autra benda segon la tua primieyra strictura; e aprop lia desus am fiel decentment segon que havem dit de strictura, e es que sia la tua strictura segon le loc de la fractura mes, e quant mes es alonguat de la fractura, es mendre la strictura.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E cove que les fils sian migiers en grossesa e subtilitat, e sian de li mol; e si les fils so grosses, ayssi cum yeu he vist per la operacio de alcus fols pausantz les lors fils de cordas de li tort, e es error gran, quan catz la strictura fora equalitat.	And make sure the threads are thicker in bulk and thinner in width, and they must be made of silk; and if you use thick threads, I have seen through my experiences that some fools place their stitches with rope-strings, which is a huge mistake because it will cause tension.
E eyssament fils subtils no so convenientz, quar tu no consaguiras per strictura am aquels aquo que voles, e no cove que entre astela e astela haja mens de un dit.	And using thinner threads is not suitable because you will not achieve the desired tightness with them; it should not be less than a finger's width between each stitch.
E si le malaute es ledit per las extremitatz de las stelas aprop la strictura en les locs sas, lahoras pausa dejos aquelas de stopa leon o lana carmenada entro que aquo no li fassa lesio.	If the patient complains of pain at the ends of the stitches and you need to tighten them in those places, then place some soft linen cloth or woolen fabric beneath to prevent injury.
Alcunas veguadas fractura es am plagua, e accideys disrupcio en la codena, e yeu vindre am rememoracio en aquela en le capitol segon singularitat.	Sometimes fractures occur with inflammation, causing a rupture in the bone; I will recall this in more detail when discussing specific cases.
E sapias que ges tot membre trencat no es streyt am stelhas al primier dia; la qual causa es quar le membre, quan es gran, no cove que pauses sobre lu stelhas sino aprop v dias o vii o mays, segon la tua seguratat de adveniment de apostema caut.	Be aware that not every broken limb can be straightened with traction on the first day; this is because when a limb is large, it should not be subjected to traction until after several days or weeks, depending on your confidence in preventing the formation of pus.
E aquesta es la manieyra dels emplaustres am les quals les Antics restauravan, les quals so pausatz sobre fractura e dislocacio e torcio.	This is the method of using plasters as practiced by ancient physicians; they were applied over fractures, dislocations, and sprains.
Manieyra de emplaustra comu abruejat de restaurament de fractura, convenient a motas compleccios e majorment a las femnas e als efantz, quar es de aquo sobre le qual no ventz calor ni freg: e es que prenguas de polvera de moli, e es la medula de la farina que pen deves le movement de la mola en las paretz del moli.	Here is my translation of the first source sentence: 
E comfeys aquel ayssi cum es, sino que cribelles aquel am album de huou, e pausa la comfeccio de lu no-spessa ni subtil; e aprop usa de aquela.	Certainly! Here is a line-by-line translation of the provided text: 
Autra manieyra de emplaustre restaurant fractura e dislocacio e torcio: recipe de assafetida, de lapdanum, de acacia, de enula, e migrach, que es razit de milgraner salvage, de totz ana drac. x; de mirra e aloen ana drac. v; alochil ana drac. xx; totz sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian mesclatz am aygua alichil o am album de huou si la compleccio del malaute es scalfada; e aprop usa de aquest emplaustre, quar es de bona composicio e restaura les osses trencatz leugierament, e confereys a motz homes.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
Autra manieyra de emplaustre le qual comfereys a fractura e torcio: recipe migrach e met de altea blanca ana drac. x; de mirra e de aloen ana drac v; de acacia drac. vi; de bol armenic drac. .xx.	Another method for applying an ointment to fractures and sprains: take myrrh and mix it with a white alum, add 10 drachms of each; aloe, 5 drachms; acacia, 6 drachms; Armenian bole, 20 drachms.
Totz sian trissatz en mortier am mota contricio, e sian cribellatz, e sian comfitz am aygua o am album de huou e sia administrat.	Grind all the ingredients together in a mortar until they are finely mixed, sieve them, and then combine with water or egg white to form a paste, which should be applied.
Manieyra de emplaustre a juncturas e osses separatz de lors locs, e seda dolor accident en aquels e a fissuras e fractaduras: sia presa lana sutza e sia submersa en vi agre e oli cuyt e sia pausat sobre le loc.	A method for applying an ointment to joints and bones that have moved out of place, as well as for sprains, fractures, and dislocations: take some soft wool, soak it in vinegar and warm oil, and apply it to the affected area.
Mays en aquest emplastre no es vertut de restauracio, de apostema caut e expelleys dolors propriament.	If this ointment does not provide any restoration or relief from abscesses, then expel the pains properly.
Autra manieyra de emplastre que restaura os trancat: pren fuelas de figuier sort e fuelas de papaver salvatge; contereys tot e fay emplastre de lor.	Another method for an ointment that restores a closed passage (i.e., an obstruction): take fresh fig leaves and wild poppy leaves, mix them together, and make an ointment from these.
Manieyra de emplastre abreujat aministrat deves la restauracio de fractura de os e quan tu voles resolucio del romanent de apostema: recipe razitz de altea, de camamilla e flors de violes, de farina de ers, de totz ana partida i; sian totz trissatz e sian cofitz am vi, si·l membre no es scalfat.	A condensed method for an ointment to be applied when restoring a fracture and seeking relief from the remainder of an abscess: take roots of marshmallow, chamomile, and violet flowers; add some flour of bran, equal parts of each, grind them together, mix with wine, and apply if the member is not scalded.
Mays si es scalfat, lahoras comfeys aquel am aygua de coliandre humit o am aygua e usa de lu.	But if it is scratched, then apply to it moist coriander water or warm water and oil.
Autra manieyra de emplastra pus fort en resolucio que aquest primier, quan accideys apostema dur deves la restauracio del membre: recipe de razitz de altea e de semensa de li, e de balaustia, e mellilot, majorana, flors de viol, de camamilla, de totz ana partida i engual; totz sian trissatz e sian cofitz am aygua de sauze o am aygua dousa o am vi, tot aquo segon la qualitat del membre e le repaus de la color de lu.	Another way to make a poultice that is more effective for resolving hardened abscesses when they occur: take roots of marshmallow and flax seeds, and also balsam fir, mallow, melilot, marjoram, violet flowers, chamomile, all of them equal parts; grind these together and moisten with willow water or warm water or wine, according to the quality of the affected body part and its color.
Mays Ypocras no diyssec en le sieu libre que sia pausat sobre le membre trenquat deves la restauracio de lu sino cerot fayt de cera e de oli e no autre causa; e recomtec que sia migier entre grossitut e subtilitat.	But Hippocrates did not say in his book that wax and oil cerate should be applied to the affected body part during its restoration process, but only if necessary; he also recommends it be neither too thick nor too thin.
Mays a Gualia es vist que sian pausatz sobre le membre trencat deves la restauracio de lu e las causas en las quals es exsiccacio am petit de caliditat so ayssi cum mirra, enses e semblantz a lor de aquelas causas que havem recomtadas.	But in Gaul [France], it is seen that they apply [poultices] to the broken body part during its restoration process and the substances for which are drying but with little heat are thus similar to myrrh, incense, and those already mentioned.
Manieyra de emplastre que comfereys a lesio e dolor: recipe migat, de cezes, de pels de home inscizes o pena de auzel, e de altea, e sal, partidas enguals; sian trissatz e cribellatz e sian cofitz, e sia fayt emplastre.	A poultice that treats the wound and eases pain: take ground, equal parts of chickpeas, human hair cuttings or bird feathers, marshmallow root, and salt; grind these together and mix them into a paste, then make it into a poultice.
Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.	Mays la quantitat segon la qual cove que romangua la liadura e aprop sia disliada, es que consideres si no es accidit dolor ni pruziment ni le os es trencat no es maugut de son loc, lahoras tu no deslies de motz jorns.
E si accideys al loc dolor vehement o prusiment o imflacio, lahoras tu te coyte o deslie aquel en la hora, e osta le emplastre de lu.	If a painful wound or severe inflammation occurs at this location, treat and untie it immediately, removing the plaster from it.
E pren drap de li e spongia marina leon humida, e submergeys aquela en aygua tebeza, e am aquela lava le loc entro que cesse aquel pruziment e la dolor sia sedada; e aprop layssa repausar le membre per una hora; e aprop pausa sobre lu lana sutza submersa en vi agre e oli o oli rozat, e lia sobre lu per una nuoyt entro que sias segur de apostema caut, e que repause la imflacio del membre, e sia remauguda la dolor de lu.	Take a cloth and a moist marine sponge, dip them into lukewarm water, and use them to wash the area until the swelling subsides and the pain is relieved. Then let the body part rest for an hour; afterward, place over it soft wool submerged in vinegar or rose oil, bind it with a bandage for one night so that you can ensure suppuration occurs safely and there is no resurgence of inflammation in the affected limb, nor any recurrence of its original pain.
E aprop itera aquela strictura subtil e emplastre petit e no·l strenhas per la tua constriccio primieyra, e subtilia am aquel entro que sia sanat.	Repeat this gentle compression and small plaster without tightening it beyond the initial restriction; apply this treatment subtly until the wound heals completely.
E si vezes que le apostema e la rogor e la dolor e la imflacio e tots les accidentz ja so remaugutz de tot, e indigeysses de emplastre e de strictura, lahoras tu itera aquel ayssi cum has fayt al comensant engualment.	If you find that the pus, scabs, pain, swelling, and all other symptoms have fully subsided, and there is no longer a need for bandages or restriction, then repeat the same treatment as was done initially.
E si no accideys al membre alcuna causa de aquelas que havem ditas, lahoras no deslies aquel sino aprop tres dias o quatre o v o vii; e alcunas veguadas tot aquo es layssat per xx dias segon que a tu appar per la desliadura del membre, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que la fractura adhereys, e se acosta a la coagulacio de la carn sobre aquel.	If no other cause of the symptoms mentioned above occurs in this limb, then do not remove the bandage for three to four or five to seven days; sometimes all of this can be left for up to twenty days depending on how quickly you see the limb heal when you loosen its binding, as we said before, until the fracture fuses and the flesh hardens over it.
E lahoras ajusta en la strictura mays que en la tua strictura primieyra tota, e ayusta en la engrossacio de la vianda del malaute, segon que es precedida la rememoracio de lu.	And then fasten it in the largest opening you made earlier, and adjust according to the swelling of the patient's body, as previously instructed.
Mays si tu vezes le loc de la fractura ja desiccar e extenuar mays que no cove, lahoras sapias que·l nutriment es prohibit pervenir ad aquel; e donc embroca aquel am aygua tebeza deves tota veguada que delias aquel; e sia aquo en totz tres dias; e alleuja la strictura un petit, e per aquesta operacio corr al membre le nutriment, e es sanat leugierament.	If you notice that the fracture site has dried out and become weaker than it was initially, understand that nourishment cannot reach that part of the body; therefore, you must apply tepid water to it whenever you treat him; do this for three consecutive days; loosen the binding slightly, through which operation nutrition will return to the limb, and he shall be healed lightly.
Mays aquo que fan les fols restauradors de la fractura del membre autra veguada quan no es restaurat al comensament, segon que cove, e es restaurat segon tortuositat, es error segon la operacio de lor, e temor gran, e si fos dreyturier aquo agrandit les Antics en lors libres e agueran am aquo obrat.	What those foolish restorers of the limb's fracture do once again when it is not healed at first as expected, and is healed according to its tortuosity, is an error on their part in this operation, and a great cause for fear; had this been rightly done by the Ancients in their books, they would have achieved something through it.
E yeu no he vist ad alcu de lor aquo far, per que es pus razonable que aquo no fassa.	And I have not seen anyone among them do this, which is all the more reason why it should not be done.
Capitol segon: De fractura quan accideys en le cap.	Chapter two: On fractures of the head.
Las specias de fracturas son motas, e las figuras de lor son diversas, e las causas son distinctas, quar de fracturas alcuna es fayta per percussio de spaza, e la percussio osta tot le os entro al ciphac, le qual es dejos le os, ayssi cum fay ayssa en le fust, e per aquo aquesta specia es nompnada ascial; o la spaza inscideys alcuna partida del os, e inscideys la carn de lu e no passa la inscizio entro al derier de lu; e aquesta specia de fractura es nompnada levatio absoluta.	There are many types of fractures, and their forms are varied, with distinct causes as well: some fractures occur due to the impact of space, which drives all of the bone into the brain, just like when an arrow pierces wood, and for this reason, this type is called 'ascial'; or else space may cut through a part of the bone, along with its flesh, but does not pass beyond that; this latter form of fracture is called 'levatio absoluta'.
E la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca, e de fractura que es contricio o atricio; e causa de lu es percussio am poyra o cazement sobre peyra, e a lor semblantz.	Certainly! Here is the translation of your provided text: 
E aquesta fractura o es penetrant que ja apropinqua al pannicol le qual es dejos le os; o es en la facia del os, e la plagua de aquestas doas fracturas o es gran o pauca.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.	E de fractura es que es ameguada en le os, en la subtilitat del cabel petita, e per aquo es nompnada aquesta specia fractura capillar.
E es fractura que es fayta o per cazement o per percussio de peyra e a lu semblantz, que fa intrar alcuna lamina del os a las partidas dedintz, e es fayta en le loc concavitat ayssi cum accideys als payroles de eram quan accideys a lor percussio e es partida de lor intrada a las partidas dedintz.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E majorment es fayt aquo en les cors de osses humitz, ayssi cum so caps de efantz.	And this is mainly done in the bodies of damp bones, as in the heads of infants.
E so a totas aquestas specias fracturas satagias, so son pessas ayssi cum stelhas separadas.	And for all these kinds of leg fractures, they should be fixed with splints like separated slats.
E yeu vindre am reremoracio de tot aquo en son loc.	And I will return to the explanation of all this in its proper place.
E conoyssem totas aquestas specias de fractura per deteccio sobre aquelas e per inquisicio de lor am tentas e ostament de carn corrumpuda que es sobre lor.	And I know all these types of fractures by touch and by questioning them about it, as well as through the examination of their corrupted flesh.
E specia capillar es conoguda per aysso que es descubert sobre le os, e es abstergit, e linit sobre lu am tentha, quar la fractura appar negra.	The type of fracture involving the scalp is known for being uncovered over the bone and being cleaned; it is bandaged with thread, as the fracture appears black.
Mays en la curacio de fractura considera al comensament les accidentz del malaute, e lahoras si tu vezes per los accidentz que signifique per significacio manifesta sobre paor, ayssi cum es vomit de colera, e extencio, e perdement de entendament, e abscizio de votz, e sincopi, e febre acuta, e eyssiment dels huels e rogor de aquels, e semblantz a lor dels accidentz en las majors disposicios, ses dopte no es sanat.	When considering the treatment of fractures at the beginning, you should look into the circumstances of the patient's injury and their symptoms; if you observe that they suffer from things like vomiting bile, fainting spells, loss of reason, loss of voice, collapse, acute fever, discharge or swelling in body parts, stiffness of limbs, and similar severe conditions to these when injured, then do not attempt treatment.
E si vezes accidentz no-correntz tu speras salut, lahoras tu comensa la curacio de lu.	If you find that the symptoms are not severe, then you may expect recovery and begin their treatment.
La qual causa es quar si es vengut a tu le plaguat en le comensament cum es plaguat e aquo es en les dias de ivern, lahoras cove que tu studias en le ostament del os denant le dia xiiii segon tota disposicio.	Here is the translation of the first sentence: 
E si es en les dias d’estiu, lahoras cove que te coytes ostar le os denant le vii dia, habantz que aquo que es dejos le os sia corromput del pannicol, e que accidescan les accidentz que havem recomtatz.	Here is the translation of the provided text:
E si la fractura ja es pervenguda al pannicol cubrent le cervel, e es am partidas menudas e atricio, lahoras cove que inscidas la partida conminuta e atrita, segon que yeu recomtare a tu.	Under the circumstances that the fracture has reached the brain, and it is divided into small pieces and bruised, you must insert the fractured part as I will tell you.
E es que tu razas le cap del malaute plaguat, e descuebres sobre le os segon costuma e manieyra a tu possible segon la figura de la plagua, e que sia leugier sobre le malaute.	When you shave the patient's head and uncover the bone according to custom and manner as is possible given the shape of their disease, ensure that it is light on them.
E si accideys a tu deves la deteccio del os, fluxs de sanc o apostema caut, lahora tu te oppausa a lu am aquo que cove, e es que huemplas le loc de draps infuzes en vi e oli rozat, e fassa repausar la plagua entro que sia sedat le apostema, e sies segur de fluxs del sanc; e aprop comensa en la circuicio del os e en la ablatio de lu.	If you find that there is bone exposure, raw flesh or pus present then refrain from what typically ought to be done and instead apply a dressing of cloth infused with wine and rose oil and let the patient rest until the abscess has calmed down and make sure the bleeding stops; Then begin by circumcising the bone and removing it.
E aquo sia segon una de dos manieyras de operacio.	This is according to one of two ways of operating.
E la una manieyra es que tu inscidas le os am inscisori de streyt tal, e aquesta es la forma de lu: E aprop administra un autre inscissori aquest, un pauc pus lat que aquel; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	One way is to insert the bone with a narrow chisel like this and then administer another one slightly wider than that and of this shape.
E aprop administra mays le inscissori pus lat que·l segon.	Then use the wider chisel more than the previous one.
E cove que sia deves tu nombre de inscissoris diverses, dels quals alcus so pus latz que alcus autres; e alcus de lor so pus breus que·ls autres e sian en le derier de acuitat de las suas extremitatz, e sian de ferr indi o felod.	Here is the translation of the provided source sentence: 
E usa de lor am facilitat en percussio sobre le inscissori per so que no concutesca le cap e leda aquel.	And use their assistance in percussion over the scrotum so as not to bruise his head and injure him.
E si le os es fort, dur, lahoras cove que perfores en le circuit de lu denant que tu administres los inscissoris am les taravels, les quals so nomnatz taravels no-profundantz.	And if the bone is strong and hard, then you must pierce it in its circumference before administering the incisions with the trephines, which are called non-penetrating trephines.
E no so nomnatz ayssi sino quar aquels no pausan le terme de l’os del test ad aquo que es aprop lu, per so quar al taravel es redonda extremitat o marge sobre aquel que es dejos le cap de lu agut semblant a marge o a cercle petit, le qual prohibeys esser submergit e passar la spissitut del os.	And they are not called thus but rather non-penetrating because these do not reach the end of the bone to which it is adjacent, for the trephine has a round edge or margin on that which is below the skull similar to a small margin or circle, which prevents being submerged and passing through the thickness of the bone.
E es convenient que tu prenguas de aquestz taravels gran nombre dels quals quascu convenesca a la spicitut de quascun os, entro que sia a tu present en tottz testz del cervel la extremitat del qual sia aguda, la quantitat en longitut e brevitat sia segon la quantitat de spicitut de aquest test.	And it is convenient that you take a large number of these trephines, each suitable for the thickness of each bone, as far as it is present in all parts of the skull whose end is sharp, and the quantity regarding its length and shortness should be according to the degree of hardness of this skull.
E aquesta es la forma de tres specias de teravels: La qualitat de perforar en le circuit del os trencat es que pauses le teravel sobre le os e revolvas aquel am les tieus ditz entro que sapias que l’os ja es penetrat; e aprop permuda le terevel ad autre loc, e pausa aquo que es entre tot trauc la quantitat de la grosseza del ray o enviro aquo.	And this is the form of three types of trephines: The quality of piercing the circumference of the broken bone is that you place the trephine on the bone and turn it with handles called *ditz*, as long as you know that the bone has already been penetrated; then change the trephine to another location, and place what is between all through the quantity of the thickness of a ray or thereabouts.
E aprop inscideys am inscissoris aquo que es entre quascun trauc del os, e fay aquel pus subtil que podes sobre aquo en fi de levitat, ayssi cum havem dit, entro que erradiques le os, o am la tua ma, o am alcuna autra causa per alcus sturmentz les quals auras apparelhatz ad aquo, ayssi cum tanalhas e forceps subtils.	Here is my line-by-line translation of the provided text: 
E cove que tu guardes am tota cautela que l’inscissori no toque alcuna causa del ciphac.	And make sure with all caution that the scissors do not touch any part of the intestines.
E donc cum auras circuit le os perforan, e sira separat del ciphac si es continuat am lu, e auras aquel extrayt, cove que razas e enguales aquel en la asperitat de lu de aquo que es en le os am autra sturment semblant a inscissori, mays empero cove que sia pus teon e pus subtil que les autres inscissoris.	Once you have encircled the perforating bone and separated it from the intestines if they are attached to it, and extracted that part, you should then file and smooth it on its rough surface with another tool similar to scissors, but make sure it is thicker and more delicate than other scissors.
E si roman alcuna partida dels osses petitz e satagias, lahoras pren aquela am facilitat am aquo que es deves tu dels sturmentz; e aprop aquo cura la plagua am lichinis e enguentz les quals havem ditz.	And if any parts of the small bones and tendons remain, take them out easily with whatever tools you have at your disposal; then treat the wound with the ointments and unguents we have mentioned.
E l’autra manieyra de operacio es leugiera, longinqua de paor, la qual diyssec Gualia e la lauzec per gran lausor; e aquest es le sermo de lu: necessari es a tu en le comensament que comenses descobrir la partida del os del loc en le qual es la fractura pus vehement e pus manifesta, entro que quan auras descubert aquela partida e auras pausat dejos lu la extremitat de aquest inscissori lent e alegre del qual aquesta es la forma:	Another surgical method is less invasive and far from causing fear, which was praised by Gallia, and I will also commend it. This is what he said about it: in the beginning, you must start by uncovering the bone part of the area where the fracture is most violent and most visible; once you have uncovered this part and placed one end of a slow and gentle tool on it, whose shape is as follows:" (followed by an illustration)
E es que la partida lenticular es leon e no inscideys alcuna causa, e la partida aguda es de lu en dos latz avantz en longitut, ayssi cum vezes; que la partida lenticular sia ajustada al ciphac am la facia de lu inscident aguda en le os. E aprop percuteys sobre le inscissori de una partida am un petit malhet entro que inscidas tot le os am facilitat ayssi cum es revolvut, e tu sias segur del pannicol que no accida en lu accident que temas en denguna manieyra, e si le medicant14 era le pus fol de totz les homes e le mays ignorant de lor; certament, e si era dorment. E si fractura del os no penetra entro al pannicol, e aquo que es abscidit o es ostat del os es la facia de lu, e roman en lu asperitat e satagias subtils, lahoras cove que razas aquella asperitat e erradiques aquellas satagias am razoris subtils per les quals tu has preparat le nombre, de diversas quantitatz per que sia a tu possible administrar de aquels en tot loc les pus convenientz de lor e le pus dreyt de aquels segon aquo en que te perduzeys la tua operacio aquel os trencat e la figura de lu.
E cove que administres en la tua razio am la qual razes le os al comensament le pus lat de aquels razoris, e aprop usa aprop lu del pus subtil de lu, e no cesses far aquo segon continuitat entro que pervenguas ad aministrar le pus teon e·l pus subtil de totz aquels.	Here is the translated text:
Mays en quascuna de las autras fracturas petitas capillars e fractura subtil, cove que administres cura segon aquo que perduseys ad rectificacio de lu.	For any of the other minor fractures or subtle breaks, it is necessary to administer treatment based on what has been lost in order to rectify it.
E es causa que no es ameguada sobre totz les quals han studi en aquela art.	And this is something that needs improvement, especially for those who have studied the subject thoroughly.
E stec sobre aquo que nos scriut havem mostrat en grans fracturas.	And this is what we have demonstrated previously regarding major fractures.
E si le pannicol es retangut quan tu erradiques le os, lahoras cove que prenguas drap de li segon la quantitat de la plagua, e submergeys aquel en oli rozat, e pausa aquel sobre le orrifici de la plagua; e aprop pren autre drap doblat o triplicat e submergeys lu en vi e oli rozat e pausa aquel sobre drap prim e fay aquo al pus leugierament que podes sobre aquel, que no graves le ciphac; e aprop administra sobre aquel liament lat, e no strenhas aquel sino per quantitat que tengua la plagua tant solament.	If the flesh is torn when you extract the bone, then you must take a cloth according to the amount of injury, and dip it in rose oil, and place it over the wound; then take another folded or tripled cloth, dipped in wine and rose oil, and place it over the first cloth with as little pressure as possible on the affected area; subsequently apply soft bandages, but do not tighten them except to match the quantity of injury.
E layssa aquel am aquesta cura per un dia o per dos entro que sias segur de apostema caut; e aprop deslia aquel e aprop aministra medicinas am las quals es superflua siccitat, ayssi cum razitz de lin e farina de errs, e polvera de enses e de aristologia, e de semblantz ad aquels.	Leave the wound to heal for a day or two until you are certain that an abscess has not formed; then untie it and apply medicines that promote dryness, such as linen rags and flour of ergot, powder of ants and of aristolochia, and similar remedies.
E es que tu fassas de aquestas medicinas polvera que sia pulverizada sobre la plagua, ayssi cum son secas; e universalment, administra en aquel tota medicina de proprietat de la qual es que abstergesca e no mordique.	And it is necessary for you to prepare these powdered medications and apply them onto the wound when dry; in general, administer all medicines of a nature that cleanses and does not bite.
E guarda te segon la tua vertut que la plagua en la tua curacio sia neta; e no sia en lu surdicia de enguent ni autra; ni no layssas agreguar virulencia en lu; quar quan es ajustada sobre le pannicol del cervel, corromp aquel e poyreys aquel, e accideys sobre le malaute aprop aquo malicia maligna.	Ensure that you maintain your integrity and ensure the wound is clean in your treatment process; avoid applying any grease or ointment onto it, nor allow any contamination to occur; for when this [grease] is spread over the brain's membrane, it corrupts it and spreads its corruption, bringing about malignant illness upon the patient.
E accideys en le ciphac del cap, cum de lu es mondificat le os e majorment quan es menspresada la cura de lu, e es negror en la superficia de lu; e donc considera lahoras si accideys al malaute les accidentz que havem ditz, sapias que es parnicios ses tot dopte.	And if there is a fracture on the skull where bone has been modified and treatment of it is delayed, especially when its surface turns black; hence, should you visit the patient with these symptoms we have mentioned, know that they are extremely dangerous.
E si no accideys negror sino de la medicina que es pausada desus, e es en vertut de aquela medicina que fassa aquela negror, lahoras cove que tu prenguas de mel una partida e de oli rozat partidas iii, e am aquels linieys un drap, e aprop pausa aquel sobre le ciphac; e aprop cura aquel am las specias de curacio que conveneys entro que sia sanat.	If there is no blackening, but rather from the medicine applied above it, and if this blackness is due to said medicine's nature, you should then prepare a mixture of beeswax, olive oil and roses in equal parts; use these ingredients to line a cloth, and place that onto the fracture. Subsequently treat any further symptoms as required until cured.

De restauracio del nas quan es trincat.	On the restoration of the nose when it is broken." 
Sapias que no es trencat del nas sino doas partidas ensemps pus sobiranas, o una de aquelas alcunas veguadas, per so quar en lu has dos osses, quar la partida dejos es cartillaginosa, e no es trencada e no accideys a lu sino atricio e tortuositat e sinuitat.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
Mays si es trencada la una de las doas partidas de lu, lahoras cove que tu intrometas le dit petit en le sieu nas, e que engualhas aquela fractura dedintz am le tieu dit indic, e am le dit pous defora, entro que retorne le nas segon la sua figura natural.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E sia fayt aquo per tu am facilitat, e guarda te que no caja per aquela tua operacio sobre le malaute delor.	And let this be done by you with ease, and take care that your operation on the patient does not cause pain.
E si la fractura es en la pus sobirana partida del nas, e le dit no perve ad aquela, lahoras cove que sia equat am la extremitat del ray en le qual sia petita grossitut.	If the fracture is in the upper part of the nose and it does not perforate to the brain, then it should be aligned with the extremity of the wing where there is a small thickness.
E si la fractura es en doas partidas, lahoras tu fay le semblant de aquo.	And if the fracture has occurred in two places, then you should do this: follow a similar procedure.
E coyta te am restauracio de lu en le primier dia de la fractura, si es possible; e sino, lahoras aprop le vii o·l x deves le repaus del apostema caut.	Endeavour to restore the patient on the first day of the fracture if it is feasible; otherwise, in seven or fourteen days you must wait for the swelling to subside.
E aprop entromet en la extremitat del nas una meca de drap de li, si la fractura es en una partida, o metz doas calguas, si la fractura es en doas partidas, e sia en la calgua grossitut de tanta quantitat que umpla le trauc del nas.	Then insert into the extremity of the nose a piece of linen cloth if the fracture is in one place, or use two combs if it is in two places, and let there be on each comb as much thickness as will fill the hole in the nose.
E diysso alcus dels antics restauradors que las calguas sian enfundudas en boder, e sian permudadas en tot dia, mays no es vist a mi; habantz cove que la meca sia enfunduda en album de huou comfit am polvera de moli; e aprop layssa la qualgua entro que l’os sia fermat e sia endurazida la cartillage.	Some ancient restorers advise that the combs should be dipped in oil and changed every day, but I have not found this to be effective. It is better if the cloth is soaked in white of egg mixed with powdered lime; then leave the comb in place until the bone is set and the cartilage hardened.
E alcunas veguadas sia entromes en le nas, en loc de calgua, pena de auca pus que es envolopada de drap de li leon; e sia que ja te la fractura del nas pus vehement e que le malaute no sia prohibit de inspiracio.	Here is the translation of the provided text: 
E aquesta causa no es a tu necessaria; e si voles, fay aquo, e si voles, fay calguas.	This reason is not necessary for you, and if you wish, do this, and if you wish, do something else.
E si accideys autra veguada apostema caut, emplastra le nas am cerot o am coto enfus en vi agre e oli rozat, o am diaquilon.	And if another abscess occurs, treat it by applying a plaster to the nose made of wax, or with cotton soaked in vinegar and rose oil, or use *diaquilon*.
Mays si no accideys apostema caut, lahoras cove que emplaustres aquel defora am farina de sizami e am polvera de enses cofitz am album de huou; e aprop pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e no lies le nas am alcuna causa.	However, if there is no abscess present, then cover the area with a plaster made of sesame flour and powder from burnt bones mixed with egg white; place it over the affected spot and do not touch your nose for any reason.
Mays si so trencats les osses del nas am fractura petita o so conminuitz, lahoras cove que scindas sobre aquels, e extraguas aquels am insturmentz que conveno ad aquels; e aprop cos la scissura, e cura aquela am aquo que encarna e consolida, e am emplastres ad aquo convenientz.	However, if the nose bones are fractured or crushed, it is necessary to cut open the affected area and remove the bone fragments with appropriate instruments; then stitch the wound, treat it with a substance that promotes flesh growth and strengthens the bone, and cover it with plasters suitable for this purpose.
E si accideys plagua dedintz le nas, lahoras cove que cures aquela am calguas e administra canulas de plom entro que sia de tot sanat.	And if there is an ulcer inside the nose, it must be treated with various applications and by inserting lead tubes until complete healing.

De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada.	De restauracio de la mandibula quan es trincada." 
Quan la mandibula dejos es rompuda e la fractura de lu no es am plagua, reguarda lahoras si la fractura es deforas tant solament, e no es trencada en dos e es curvada a las partidas dedintz, lahoras la sua cognicio es leugiera.	When the jaw is broken and there's no visible damage on it, check if the fracture is only on the outside surface, not in two pieces or curved at the inner edges; then its diagnosis is mild.
E cove donc, si la fractura es en la part dreyta, que tu intrometas le tieu indic senestre en la boca del malaute; e semblantment si la fractura es an la mandibula senestra, lahoras intromet le dit indic de la ma dreyta; e impelleys am aquel la gilbositat de la fractura dedintz am facilitat a las partidas defora, am la tua autra ma de la partida defora del os; am aquel decentment equa aquelam.	And now, if the fracture is on the right side, you should insert your left index finger into the patient's mouth; similarly, if it's on the left jaw, use your right index finger; then push with that finger against the bump of the fracture inside and ease out the outer edges using your other hand from outside the bone, moving it decently towards that one.
E si la fractura de la mandibula ja es separada en doas, lahoras cove que administres extensio de doas partz segon rectitut entro que sia possibla la equacio de lu.	If the jaw fracture is already separated into two pieces, then you need to apply an extension of both parts according to their original straightness as much as possible for them to align properly.
E si accideys conmocio de dentz a disrupcio, lahoras strenh aquelas de las quals speras que romandran am fil de aur o de argent o de ceda; e aprop pausa sobre la mandibula trencada cerot, e aprop pausa sobre lu drap duplicat, e pausa sobre le drap gran stelha decentment fayta, o una pessa de sola engual a la longitut de la mandibula; e aprop lia aquela desus segon que a tu es apparelhada la liadura de lu e que conveneys la applicacio, entro que no es destruida.	And if there's tooth dislocation along with the jaw fracture, then bind those that will stay connected by a gold or silver wire, or cedar twine; then place on the broken jaw some wax, and on top of it a folded cloth, and on this one a large star-shaped piece of linen as long as the jaw; then tie it all together according to how you've arranged their position so they don't move.
E comanda al malaute que use de repaus e tranquilitat, e pausa la vianda de lu sorbicios leons.	Under these conditions command the patient with rest and tranquility, and give him a low-salt diet, which must be accompanied by cold baths.
E si extimas que ja es alterada la figura en alcuna manieyra, lahoras tu te coyta e deslia aquel al tertz dia; e aprop rectifica aquo que ja es alterat de lu e emplaustra aquel am polvera de moli, am album de huou, o am farina de cisami, pus que tu auras ostat le cerot de lu, e pausa sobre le emplastra lana leon.	If you notice that the figure is already altered in some way, then wait and untie him on the third day; afterwards correct what has been changed from him, with ointment of mallow powder, egg albumin or oat flour, since you will have removed his cerot, and place over the plaster sheep wool.
E adonc cum sta annex e ajustat aquel emplastre sobre lu, e la disposicio del os no es alterada, layssa aquel, que no le deslies entro que sia sanat e strenh la fractura; quar motas veguadas aquesta fractura es streyta en tres sempmanas.	And so when this plaster is attached and adjusted to him, and the bone's position is not altered, let it be, do not remove it until he is healed and the fracture has consolidated; because in many occasions this fracture consolidates within three weeks.
E si autra veguada accida apostema caut, lahoras administra aquo que havem dit motas veguadas en la sedacio de lu entro que sia sanat, e sia remaugut aquel apostema.	And if another wound becomes infected, then administer what we have mentioned previously for its healing many times a day until it is cured and the abscess has drained.
E si la fractura es am plagua, lahoras considera si es pessa del os separada o satagias, lahoras tu te subtilia que ostes aquelas satagias am aquo que conveneys ad aquo en la remocio de aquelas dels sturmentz.	And if the fracture is infected with pus, then consider whether it is a part of the bone that has separated or is the periosteum; afterwards you must be subtle and remove those periostea with what suits this operation among these tools.
E si le orrifici de la plagua es streyt, lahoras tu le amplifique am le fleubotomi segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat.	If the wound's openings are narrow, then you should widen them with a lancet according to your required extent.
E aprop quan tu auras ostat aquelas satagias, e de aquelas no sira remaugut re, lahoras tu cos le orrifici de la plagua si es ampla; e sino, pausa sobre aquela un dels emplaustres que conveneysso ad aquo e encarnan aquela, entro que sia sanada.	Then, once you have followed these strategies and nothing has improved, sew up the wound if it is wide; otherwise, apply a plaster suitable for this purpose and let the flesh grow over it until it heals.

De restauracio de la furcula quan es trinquada.	On restoring the collarbone when it is fractured." 
Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquela fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.	Motas veguadas es trencada la furcula de la partida denant deves le muscle, e aquella fractura es fayta en una de tres manieyras.
Quar o es trencada, o seperada, o es seperada en doas partz otra que no accidan satagias; e es leugier a la restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que accideysso en lu satagias, e es dificil a restauracio de lu; o es ayssi que la fractura es am plagua.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E la operacio en aquela, quan la fractura es ses plagua, es que tu fassas esser present dos ministres, per so que la un tengua le adjutori e siegua la furcula trencada, e l’autre extenda le col ves aquela partida.	Here is my translation of the provided text: 
E aprop enguala la fractura am les tieus ditz entro que sia fayta la forma de lu segon que cove, e no sia en lu eminencia pauca ni concavitat.	And then use your fingers to grasp the fracture and adjust it so that its form fits properly, without leaving much prominence or cavity.
E si indigeysses mes de extencio, lahoras cove que pauses dejos le titillic del malaute spera de drap o de lana, e sia la grandesa de lu segon la quantitat de la tua necessitat; e exten e eleva la furcula e coarta la spera am la tua ma entro que enguales la frectura segon que cove.	And if you require more extension, then place a pad of cloth or wool under the patient's chin, and let its size be according to your need; extend and lift the fork (referring to a medical instrument), and with your hand, shorten the pad so that you can properly align the fracture.
E si no podes atirar la extremitat de la furcula a las partidas defora, per so quar es pervenguda al preon, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia ressupinat sobre la sua cervitz, e pauses sobre le muscle de lu un coyssi migier en grandeza.	If you are unable to draw the outer ends of the fork towards each other due to its position on the bone, then turn the patient onto their neck (or possibly their back), and place a moderate-sized cushion under their muscle.
E le ministre prema le muscle de lu a las partidas dejos entro que l’os de la furcula sia elevat que es en le preon en sus, e lahoras tu rectifique la fractura e enguala aquela am les tieus ditz.	The assistant presses the patient's muscle downwards on either side of the bone, lifting up the fork on its inner ends towards the wound, and then you can correct the fracture and align it with your fingers.
Mays si sentes satagias de la furcula e so maugudas, lahoras cove que fendes sobre aquela e extraguas aquelas satagias am facilitat.	However, if you feel any splinters on the fork (i.e., the bone) and they are loose, then it is necessary to cut into them and remove those splinters carefully.
E si es retenguda en le os, lahoras tu ingenia inscisio de lu am un dels inscissoris les quals has apparelhatz ad aquo, pus que havias pausat dejos la furcula le sturment que serve le ciphac; e es sturment de fust o de ferr del qual aquesta es la forma de lu:	And if the splinters are retained within the bone, then you must devise an incision of it using one of your incising instruments prepared for this purpose. You have placed under the fork the instrument that serves as a lever; this is made of wood or iron and has such a form:" (likely referring to a diagram)
E es semblant a culier del qual aquesta es la concavitat; e sia la sua latitut segon aquo que has necessitat de lu, segon la grandeza del os o la pauqueza de lu.	And it resembles the groin area, which is like a hollow for this purpose; and let its width be according to what you need of him, depending on his size or thinness.
Mays la longitut de lu sia segon que es a tu possible a la operacio; que haja doas extremitatz ayssi cum vezes, e la una extremitat sia ample e l’autre streyta.	Let its length be as convenient for you during the operation; it should have two ends with one end being wide and the other narrow.
E si la disrupcio de la plagua la qual has inscidida quan has extraytas la satagia del os es ampla, e yest segur de apostema caut, lahoras tu ajusta las doas labias de la plagua am sutura.	And if the incision of the wound that you made when extracting the splinter from the bone is wide, and there is a risk of abscess formation, then you should join the two lips of the wound with stitches.
E si la disrupcio es pauca, o temes apostema caut, lahoras tu uemple la plagua am draps e pulvils segon la quantitat de la scissura de la plagua.	If the incision is small or you are concerned about abscess formation, then fill the wound with cloths and powders according to the size of the gap in the wound.
E si accideys apostema caut, lahoras infon drap en vi agre e oli rozat e vi, e pausa sobre aquel.	If an abscess occurs, dip a cloth in vinegar and rose oil mixed with wine, then place it on the affected area.
Mays la strictura del os quan es ses plagua e ses seccio, es que pauses emplastre fayt de farina de moli am album de huou, e pausa sobre lu stopa leon, e aprop pausa la spera dejos le titillic de lu, si indigeyssas de aquela, e aprop pren humemate, so es torca la qual teno les Sarrazis , que sia mot longua, e sia latitut de lu de un palm o entorn aquel; e aprop pausa pulvils duplicatz sobre la stopa e l’emplastre; e aprop pren una stela de taula subtil de la qual la latitut d’ela sia de tres ditz e en longitut semblantment; e aprop envolopa aquela en drap, e aprop envolopa aquel drap am la stela en lo loc sobre le loc de la fractura; e aprop pausa humemati ayssi cum es revout, e revol aquela sobre le col de lu e dejos le titillic de lu sa e dejos le titillic de lu malaute, e reduzeys aquela sobre tota partida, e quan vezes que la strictura de la fractura am strictura descent, e es aquo que no es occultat sobre tu.	But if the constriction of the bone after its wound and incision is that you place a plaster made from flour mixed with egg white, and put it on lion fat, then apply the sphere under his armpit, if required, and take a poultice, which is a treatment used by the Saracens, making it very long, and let its width be about one palm or similar; then place double powders over the fat and plaster. Next, take a thin piece of wood whose width is three fingers, and wrap it in cloth, then wrap that cloth with the wooden piece on the location of the fracture; after this, apply another poultice like before, and turn that around his neck from his healthy armpit to his injured one, and secure it over all parts until you see that the constriction of the fracture has descended. This is what I have not omitted regarding this.
E tot, que no sia mauguda la stelha desobre le os trencat; e per so cove que tu vejas le malaute quascun dia, que quan le liament es mollificat o vezas la stela ja esser remauguda, lahoras tu rectifica aquo e strenh la liadura.	And make sure the star-shaped wound is not covering the broken bone; thus, you must see the patient every day so that when the ligature has softened or you see the star being remolded again, then you correct it and tighten the binding.
E aprop pausa le dormir del malaute sobre le col de lu, e pausa dejos le titillic de lu deves le dormir de lu en la nueyt un petit coyssi; per so que am aquel sia elevat le adjutori de lu del latz de aquel, e donc es elevada la la fractura de la furcula a elevacio del muscle; o sia le bras de lu liat al col de aquel.	Then make the patient sleep on their neck, and place underneath them at night a small cushion under their right side so that it raises the helper of theirs from that side, and thus elevates the fracture in the shoulder to elevate the muscle; or bind their arm to their neck.
E no deslies le liament si no accideys en le loc prusiment o apostema, entro a xii dias.	And do not remove the binding unless there is an accident in that place or an abscess forms within 12 days.
E aprop renovelha le emplastre si has vista la facia de lu ad aquo, e ajusta en la strictura e restaura aquel e layssa entro que sia restaurat e sia coagulat la fractura de la furcula.	Then renew the plaster if you have seen the face of the patient swell to that, and tighten it in a firm way and restore that, and let be until it is restored and the shoulder fracture has healed.
E es strenguda e comfortada segon le mes en xxviii dias, e alcunas veguadas en alcus homes es fayt en mens de temps de aquel.	And it is tightened and strengthened according to the month in 28 days; for some men, this may take less time.

De restauracio de fractura de la spalla.	When it comes to restoring a broken shoulder," 
Spatula tart es trencada en le loc lat de lu e no so trencatz de lu sino les marges.	Spatula tart is broken in its place beneath it, and not torn away from it but only its edges.
E donc quan es trencat le loc de lu — e es trencat en le mieg loc de lu — e no es conogut sino per tocament, lahoras segon que es la figura de la fractura sforsa te la preparacio de lu e reduzir aquela segon la figura natural en tota manieyra de engen la qual es a tu possible.	And so when the place of it is broken - and it is broken in its middle part - and it is only known through touch, then according to what you see as the fracture's shape force yourself to prepare it and reduce that based on its natural figure in all ways which are available to you.
E aprop pausa sobre le loc polvera de moli am album de huou e stopa leon; e aprop pausa pulvil de drap duplicat; e aprop pausa sobre lu stela lada de taula subtil segon la quantitat de la spatula tota o mays un pauc.	Then place over the area powder of moly with egg white and wax, then place a cloth pad on top, then gently place upon it a star-shaped tablet according to the quantity of the whole spatula or slightly more.
Mays si dejos la stela es concavitat en alcu dels locs de la spatula, lahoras tu enguala aquela concavitat am stopa leon, e aprop pueja la stela segon equalitat.	But if the star has a cavity in any of the places of the spatula, then fill that cavity with wax, and adjust the star according to equality.
E aprop strenh desus am humemati longua ab constriccio decent e am fermesa de la stela entro que no sia remauguda del sieu loc.	Then strengthen it from above with a long rod with decent compression and the firmness of the star so that it is not pushed out of its place.
E considera le liament en quascun dia; e totas veguadas que sia mollificat, lia autra veguada e stren le e equa la stela si es remauguda del sieu loc.	And consider the binding on each day; and every time it becomes loosened, bind again and tighten it and adjust the star if it is pushed out of its place.
E jagua le malaute sobre le sieu latz sa.	And place the patient on his side.
E la spatula es restaurada en xx dias o en .xxv.	The spatula is healed in twenty days or five weeks." 
E donc quan es complit aquest nombre, lahoras tu dissolveys le liament, e que tu scias ensegurat quar aquela es dels osses dels quals la cominicio no es temuda ni lor dissolucio.	And so, when this number is completed, you then dissolve the binding, and ensure that you know which bones have a safe beginning and their dissolution.
E si procezeys del loc del os pessa e pongeys dejos la codena, lahoras tu scindeys sobre lu, e osta le, e fay segon que havem dit en la fractura de la furcula de sadacio de apostema caut si accideys aqui.	And if you are operating on the place of the hip bone and placing a chain there, then you make an incision over it, open it up, and proceed as we have mentioned for the fracture of the shoulder blade, being cautious about any abscess that may occur.

De restauracio de la fractura del pietz.	On the restoration of fractures of the foot.
Le pietz alcunas veguadas es romput en le mieg loc de lu e aquo tart endeve; mays las extremitatz de lu mot endeve que so ciccadas e comminuidas.	Sometimes the foot is fractured in its middle part and this usually happens to both ends, but also many times just one end of it is broken or crushed.
E dels accidentz de lu quan es trencat le mieg de lu es que declina a las partidas dedintz e accideys a lu gran dolor, e dificultat en lo hale, e tos, e fort leu e vomeys sanc; e es declarada en lu cavitat en le os trencat e no es occulta al sentiment.	And among the complications when the middle of the foot is fractured are that it often affects nearby parts and causes great pain to them, difficulty in walking, coughing, and strong vomiting of blood; this complication is evident as there is a cavity inside the broken bone and it is not hidden from feeling.
E la restauracio de lu es que sia resupinat le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa entre las spallas de lu un coyssi; e aprop prem als muscles de lu, e ajusta las costas de lu am las mas de dos costatz, e subtilia te en la operacio de lu e en la equacio segon tota manieyra que es ad aquo possibla e que conveneys ad aquo, entro que retorne la figura del os segon que cove.	And for the restoration of the foot, have the patient be laid on their back and place a cushion under their shoulders; then press their muscles and adjust their sides with both hands, performing the operation delicately and in every way that is possible and convenient to them until you restore the bone's figure as it was.
E aprop pausa sobre lu emplastre e estopa e pausa desobre astela de taula subtil de sauze o de caligi e de a lor semblantz en levitat, pus que tu envolopas aquela en drap; e aprop subtilia te en lian aquela sobre le os trencat que no sia maugut; e vay am liadura segon retonditat al dors alcunas veguadas, e strenh aquel am strictura decent; e aprop considera la liadura en tota hora, e quan es mollificada strenh aquela.
